<h3 id="unhide_row_3">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_4">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Checkbox Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior.
Note that changing visibility may cause element to change locations when made visible after invisible</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    checkbox_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>if True checks the checkbox, False clears it</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>Text to display next to checkbox</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text. Note this also changes the color of the checkmark</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_3">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_3">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_3">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_3">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_3">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="get_1">Get</h3>
<p>Return the current state of this checkbox</p>
<p><code>Get()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Current state of checkbox</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="setfocus_3">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">SetFocus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>

<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_3">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetTooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>

</tr>
</thead>

<tr>

<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_5">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Checkbox Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior.
Note that changing visibility may cause element to change locations when made visible after invisible</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    checkbox_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>if True checks the checkbox, False clears it</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>Text to display next to checkbox</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text. Note this also changes the color of the checkmark</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="column-element">Column Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">A container element that <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> used <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">create</span> a layout <span class="hljs-keyword">within</span> your <span class="hljs-keyword">window</span><span class="hljs-string">'s layout
</span></code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Column</span>(layout,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    s <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    size_subsample_width <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    size_subsample_height <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-number">2</span>,
    pad <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    p <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    scrollable <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    vertical_scroll_only <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    right_click_menu <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    k <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    justification <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    element_justification <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    vertical_alignment <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    grab <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    expand_x <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    expand_y <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    metadata <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_trough_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_arrow_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_width <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_arrow_width <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_frame_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_relief <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Element]]</td>
<td>layout</td>
<td>Layout that will be shown in the Column container</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background of entire Column</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int or None, int or None)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(width, height) size in pixels (doesn't work quite right, sometimes only 1 dimension is set by tkinter. Use a Sizer Element to help set sizes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int or None, int or None)</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>size_subsample_width</td>
<td>Determines the size of a scrollable column width based on 1/size_subsample * required size. 1 = match the contents exactly, 2 = 1/2 contents size, 3 = 1/3. Can be a fraction to make larger than required.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>size_subsample_height</td>
<td>Determines the size of a scrollable height based on 1/size_subsample * required size. 1 = match the contents exactly, 2 = 1/2 contents size, 3 = 1/3. Can be a fraction to make larger than required..</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>scrollable</td>
<td>if True then scrollbars will be added to the column. If you update the contents of a scrollable column, be sure and call Column.contents_changed also</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>vertical_scroll_only</td>
<td>if True then no horizontal scrollbar will be shown if a scrollable column</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>justification</td>
<td>set justification for the Column itself. Note entire row containing the Column will be affected</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>element_justification</td>
<td>All elements inside the Column will have this justification 'left', 'right', 'center' are valid values</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>vertical_alignment</td>
<td>Place the column at the 'top', 'center', 'bottom' of the row (can also use t,c,r). Defaults to no setting (tkinter decides)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab</td>
<td>If True can grab this element and move the window around. Default is False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the column will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the column will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_trough_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the trough</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_background_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the background of the arrow buttons at the ends AND the color of the "thumb" (the thing you grab and slide). Switches to arrow color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the arrow at the ends of the scrollbar (it looks like a button). Switches to background color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width of the arrow on the scrollbar. It will potentially impact the overall width of the scrollbar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_frame_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar Color of frame around scrollbar (available only on some ttk themes)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_relief</td>
<td>Scrollbar relief that will be used for the "thumb" of the scrollbar (the thing you grab that slides). Should be a constant that is defined at starting with "RELIEF_" - RELIEF_RAISED, RELIEF_SUNKEN, RELIEF_FLAT, RELIEF_RIDGE, RELIEF_GROOVE, RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="bind_4">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

<thead>
<tr>

<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_4">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="contents_changed">contents_changed</h3>
<p>When a scrollable column has part of its layout changed by making elements visible or invisible or the
        layout is extended for the Column, then this method needs to be called so that the new scroll area
        is computed to match the new contents.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">contents_changed()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="expand_4">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_4">get_next_focus</h3>

<h3 id="get_size_4">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_4">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_4">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_4">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="layout">layout</h3>
<p>Can use like the Window.Layout method, but it's better to use the layout parameter when creating</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">layout</span>(rows)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

</tr>
</thead>

<tr>

<td>The rows of Elements</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Column)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Used for chaining</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="key_2">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_2">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_4">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_4">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_4">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_4">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_4">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_4">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>

</code></pre>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_4">unbind</h3>

</code></pre>

<h3 id="set_vscroll_position_2">set_vscroll_position</h3>

</code></pre>

</table>
<h3 id="unhide_row_4">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_6">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Column Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_4">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_4">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_4">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_4">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_4">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="addrow">AddRow</h3>
<p>Not recommended user call.  Used to add rows of Elements to the Column Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">AddRow</span>(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> or N object&gt;)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Element]</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>The list of elements for this row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="layout_1">Layout</h3>
<p>Can use like the Window.Layout method, but it's better to use the layout parameter when creating</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">Layout</span>(rows)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Element]]</td>
<td>rows</td>
<td>The rows of Elements</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Column)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Used for chaining</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="update_7">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Column Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>

<hr>
<h2 id="combo-element">Combo Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs python">ComboBox Element - A combination of a single-line <span class="hljs-built_in">input</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">and</span> a drop-down menu. User can <span class="hljs-built_in">type</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> their own value <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> choose <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">list</span>.
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">Combo(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span>,
    default_value <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    s <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    auto_size_text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    button_background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    button_arrow_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    bind_return_key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    change_submits <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_events <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_per_char_events <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    k <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    pad <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    p <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    expand_x <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    tooltip <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    readonly <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Any] or Tuple[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>values to choose. While displayed as text, the items returned are what the caller supplied, not text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>default_value</td>
<td>Choice to be displayed as initial value. Must match one of values variable contents</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>width, height. Width = characters-wide, height = NOTE it's the number of entries to show in the list. If an Int is passed rather than a tuple, then height is auto-set to 1 and width is value of the int</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_text</td>
<td>True if element should be the same size as the contents</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>button_background_color</td>
<td>The color of the background of the button on the combo box</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>button_arrow_color</td>
<td>The color of the arrow on the button on the combo box</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>bind_return_key</td>
<td>If True, then the return key will cause a the Combo to generate an event when return key is pressed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>change_submits</td>
<td>DEPRICATED DO NOT USE. Use <code>enable_events</code> instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>Turns on the element specific events. Combo event is when a choice is made</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_per_char_events</td>
<td>Enables generation of events for every character that's input. This is like the Input element's events</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text that will appear when mouse hovers over this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>readonly</td>
<td>make element readonly (user can't change). True means user cannot change</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_5">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_5">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_5">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_2">get</h3>
<p>Returns the current (right now) value of the Combo.  DO NOT USE THIS AS THE NORMAL WAY OF READING A COMBO!
You should be using values from your call to window.read instead.  Know what you're doing if you use it.</p>
<p><code>get()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>None</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_5">get_next_focus</h3>
<p>Gets the next element that should get focus after this element.</p>
<p><code>get_next_focus()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Element)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Element that will get focus after this one</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_previous_focus_5">get_previous_focus</h3>
<p>Gets the element that should get focus previous to this element.</p>
<p><code>get_previous_focus()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Element)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Element that should get the focus before this one</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_size_5">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_5">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_5">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_5">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_3">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_3">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_5">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_5">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_5">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_5">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_5">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_5">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_tooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_5">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">unbind</span>(bind_string)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>

<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unhide_row_5">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_8">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Combo Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior.
Note that the state can be in 3 states only.... enabled, disabled, readonly even
though more combinations are available. The easy way to remember is that if you
change the readonly parameter then you are enabling the element.</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    set_to_index <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    readonly <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    <span class="hljs-keyword">select</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>change which value is current selected based on new list of previous list of choices</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>change list of choices</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>set_to_index</td>
<td>change selection to a particular choice starting with index = 0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>readonly</td>
<td>if True make element readonly (user cannot change any choices). Enables the element if either choice are made.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>width, height. Width = characters-wide, height = NOTE it's the number of entries to show in the list</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>select</td>
<td>if True, then the text will be selected, if False then selection will be cleared</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_5">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_5">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_5">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_5">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_5">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="get_3">Get</h3>
<p>Returns the current (right now) value of the Combo.  DO NOT USE THIS AS THE NORMAL WAY OF READING A COMBO!
You should be using values from your call to window.read instead.  Know what you're doing if you use it.</p>
<p><code>Get()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>None</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="setfocus_5">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">SetFocus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_5">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetTooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_9">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Combo Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior.
Note that the state can be in 3 states only.... enabled, disabled, readonly even
though more combinations are available. The easy way to remember is that if you
change the readonly parameter then you are enabling the element.</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    set_to_index <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    readonly <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    <span class="hljs-keyword">select</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>change which value is current selected based on new list of previous list of choices</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>change list of choices</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>set_to_index</td>
<td>change selection to a particular choice starting with index = 0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>

</tr>

</tr>

<hr>
<h2 id="frame-element">Frame Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs scss"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">A</span> <span class="hljs-selector-tag">Frame</span> Element that contains other Elements. Encloses with <span class="hljs-selector-tag">a</span> line around elements and <span class="hljs-selector-tag">a</span> text <span class="hljs-selector-tag">label</span>.
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Frame(title,
    layout,
    title_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    title_location = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    relief = <span class="hljs-string">"groove"</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    border_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    right_click_menu = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    expand_x = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    element_justification = <span class="hljs-string">"left"</span>,
    vertical_alignment = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>text that is displayed as the Frame's "label" or title</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Elements]]</td>
<td>layout</td>
<td>The layout to put inside the Frame</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title_color</td>
<td>color of the title text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>background color of the Frame</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>enum</td>
<td>title_location</td>
<td>location to place the text title. Choices include: TITLE_LOCATION_TOP TITLE_LOCATION_BOTTOM TITLE_LOCATION_LEFT TITLE_LOCATION_RIGHT TITLE_LOCATION_TOP_LEFT TITLE_LOCATION_TOP_RIGHT TITLE_LOCATION_BOTTOM_LEFT TITLE_LOCATION_BOTTOM_RIGHT</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>enum</td>
<td>relief</td>
<td>relief style. Values are same as other elements with reliefs. Choices include RELIEF_RAISED RELIEF_SUNKEN RELIEF_FLAT RELIEF_RIDGE RELIEF_GROOVE RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(width, height) Sets an initial hard-coded size for the Frame. This used to be a problem, but was fixed in 4.53.0 and works better than Columns when using the size paramter</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. for the TITLE. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>border_width</td>
<td>width of border around element in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab</td>
<td>If True can grab this element and move the window around. Default is False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>element_justification</td>
<td>All elements inside the Frame will have this justification 'left', 'right', 'center' are valid values</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>vertical_alignment</td>
<td>Place the Frame at the 'top', 'center', 'bottom' of the row (can also use t,c,r). Defaults to no setting (tkinter decides)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="add_row_1">add_row</h3>
<p>Not recommended user call.  Used to add rows of Elements to the Frame Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">add_row</span>(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> or N object&gt;)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Element]</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>The list of elements for this row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_6">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_6">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_6">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_6">get_next_focus</h3>
<p>Gets the next element that should get focus after this element.</p>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>

<td>(Element)</td>

</tr>

</table>

<h3 id="get_size_6">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_6">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_6">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_6">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="layout_2">layout</h3>
<p>Can use like the Window.Layout method, but it's better to use the layout parameter when creating</p>

</code></pre>

<h3 id="key_4">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_4">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>

<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_6">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_6">property: metadata</h4>

<tr>

<th>Meaning</th>

</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_6">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_6">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>

</tr>

<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_6">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="unhide_row_6">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_10">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Frame Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>New text value to show on frame</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_6">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_6">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_6">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_6">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_6">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="addrow_1">AddRow</h3>
<p>Not recommended user call.  Used to add rows of Elements to the Frame Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">AddRow</span>(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> or N object&gt;)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Element]</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>The list of elements for this row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="update_11">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Frame Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>

<hr>
<h2 id="graph-element">Graph Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs vbnet">Creates an area <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> you <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> draw <span class="hljs-keyword">on</span>.  The MAGICAL <span class="hljs-keyword">property</span> this Element has <span class="hljs-built_in">is</span> that you interact
<span class="hljs-keyword">with</span> the element <span class="hljs-keyword">using</span> your own coordinate system.  This <span class="hljs-built_in">is</span> an important point!!  YOU define <span class="hljs-keyword">where</span> the location
<span class="hljs-built_in">is</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> (<span class="hljs-number">0</span>,<span class="hljs-number">0</span>).  Want (<span class="hljs-number">0</span>,<span class="hljs-number">0</span>) <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> be <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> the middle <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> the graph <span class="hljs-built_in">like</span> a math <span class="hljs-number">4</span>-quadrant graph?  No problem!  <span class="hljs-keyword">Set</span> your
lower left corner <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> be (-<span class="hljs-number">100</span>,-<span class="hljs-number">100</span>) <span class="hljs-built_in">and</span> your upper right <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> be (<span class="hljs-number">100</span>,<span class="hljs-number">100</span>) <span class="hljs-built_in">and</span> you<span class="hljs-comment">'ve got yourself a graph with</span>
(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>,<span class="hljs-number">0</span>) at the center.
One <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> THE coolest <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> the Elements.
You can also use float values. <span class="hljs-keyword">To</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">do</span> so, be sure <span class="hljs-built_in">and</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">set</span> the float_values parameter.
Mouse click <span class="hljs-built_in">and</span> drag events are possible <span class="hljs-built_in">and</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> the (x,y) coordinates <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> the mouse
Drawing primitives <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> an <span class="hljs-string">"id"</span> that <span class="hljs-built_in">is</span> referenced <span class="hljs-keyword">when</span> you want <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> operation <span class="hljs-keyword">on</span> that item (e.g. <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">erase</span> it)
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">Graph(canvas_size,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">graph_bottom_left,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">graph_top_right,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">pad</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">p</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">change_submits</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">drag_submits</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">enable_events</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">motion_events</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">key</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">k</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">tooltip</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">right_click_menu</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_x</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_y</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">visible</span> = <span class="hljs-string">True,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">float_values</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">border_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">0,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">metadata</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>canvas_size</td>
<td>size of the canvas area in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>graph_bottom_left</td>
<td>(x,y) The bottoms left corner of your coordinate system</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>graph_top_right</td>
<td>(x,y) The top right corner of your coordinate system</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>background color of the drawing area</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>change_submits</td>
<td>* DEPRICATED DO NOT USE. Use <code>enable_events</code> instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>drag_submits</td>
<td>if True and Events are enabled for the Graph, will report Events any time the mouse moves while button down. When the mouse button is released, you'll get an event = graph key + '+UP' (if key is a string.. if not a string, it'll be made into a tuple)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>If True then clicks on the Graph are immediately reported as an event. Use this instead of change_submits</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>motion_events</td>
<td>If True then if no button is down and the mouse is moved, an event is generated with key = graph key + '+MOVE' (if key is a string, it not a string then a tuple is returned)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element (Default = True)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>float_values</td>
<td>If True x,y coordinates are returned as floats, not ints</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>border_width</td>
<td>width of border around element in pixels. Not normally used for Graph Elements</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_12">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Graph Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>???</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_7">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_7">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bring_figure_to_front">bring_figure_to_front</h3>
