<td>int</td>
<td>figure</td>
<td>value returned by tkinter when creating the figure / drawing</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="change_coordinates">change_coordinates</h3>
<p>Changes the corrdinate system to a new one.  The same 2 points in space are used to define the coorinate
system - the bottom left and the top right values of your graph.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">change_coordinates</span>(graph_bottom_left, graph_top_right)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) (x,y)</td>
<td>graph_bottom_left</td>
<td>The bottoms left corner of your coordinate system</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  (x,y)</td>
<td>graph_top_right</td>
<td>The top right corner of your coordinate system</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="delete_figure">delete_figure</h3>

<h3 id="draw_arc">draw_arc</h3>
<p>Draws different types of arcs.  Uses a "bounding box" to define location</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">draw_arc(top_left,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">bottom_right,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">extent,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">start_angle,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">style</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">arc_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"black",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">line_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">1,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">fill_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>top_left</td>
<td>the top left point of bounding rectangle</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>bottom_right</td>
<td>the bottom right point of bounding rectangle</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>extent</td>
<td>Andle to end drawing. Used in conjunction with start_angle</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>start_angle</td>
<td>Angle to begin drawing. Used in conjunction with extent</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>style</td>
<td>Valid choices are One of these Style strings- 'pieslice', 'chord', 'arc', 'first', 'last', 'butt', 'projecting', 'round', 'bevel', 'miter'</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>arc_color</td>
<td>color to draw arc with</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>fill_color</td>
<td>color to fill the area</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>id returned from tkinter that you'll need if you want to manipulate the arc</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="draw_circle">draw_circle</h3>

    <span class="hljs-attr">fill_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">line_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"black",</span>

</code></pre>

<h3 id="draw_text">draw_text</h3>
<p>Draw some text on your graph.  This is how you label graph number lines for example</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">draw_text(text,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">location,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"black",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">font</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">angle</span> = <span class="hljs-string">0,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">text_location</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"center")</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>text to display</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>location to place first letter</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>color</td>
<td>text color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>angle</td>
<td>Angle 0 to 360 to draw the text. Zero represents horizontal text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>enum</td>
<td>text_location</td>
<td>"anchor" location for the text. Values start with TEXT_LOCATION_</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>id returned from tkinter that you'll need if you want to manipulate the text</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="erase">erase</h3>
<p>Erase the Graph - Removes all figures previously "drawn" using the Graph methods (e.g. DrawText)</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">erase()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="expand_7">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_bounding_box">get_bounding_box</h3>
<p>Given a figure, returns the upper left and lower right bounding box coordinates</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">get_bounding_box</span>(figure)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>object</td>
<td>figure</td>
<td>a previously drawing figure</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[int, int, int, int] or Tuple[float, float, float, float]</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>upper left x, upper left y, lower right x, lower right y</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_figures_at_location">get_figures_at_location</h3>
<p>Returns a list of figures located at a particular x,y location within the Graph</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">get_figures_at_location</span>(location)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>point to check</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[int]</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>a list of previously drawn "Figures" (returned from the drawing primitives)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_7">get_next_focus</h3>

<h3 id="get_size_7">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_7">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_7">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_7">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="move">move</h3>
<p>Moves the entire drawing area (the canvas) by some delta from the current position.  Units are indicated in your coordinate system indicated number of ticks in your coordinate system</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">move</span>(x_direction, y_direction)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>x_direction</td>
<td>how far to move in the "X" direction in your coordinates</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>y_direction</td>
<td>how far to move in the "Y" direction in your coordinates</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="move_figure">move_figure</h3>
<p>Moves a previously drawn figure using a "delta" from current position</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">move_figure</span>(figure,
    x_direction,
    y_direction)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>id</td>
<td>figure</td>
<td>Previously obtained figure-id. These are returned from all Draw methods</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>x_direction</td>
<td>delta to apply to position in the X direction</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>y_direction</td>
<td>delta to apply to position in the Y direction</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="relocate_figure">relocate_figure</h3>
<p>Move a previously made figure to an arbitrary (x,y) location. This differs from the Move methods because it
uses absolute coordinates versus relative for Move</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">relocate_figure</span>(figure,
    x,
    y)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>id</td>
<td>figure</td>
<td>Previously obtained figure-id. These are returned from all Draw methods</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>x</td>
<td>location on X axis (in user coords) to move the upper left corner of the figure</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>y</td>
<td>location on Y axis (in user coords) to move the upper left corner of the figure</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="send_figure_to_back">send_figure_to_back</h3>

</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>figure</td>
<td>value returned by tkinter when creating the figure / drawing</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="key_5">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_5">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_7">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_7">property: metadata</h4>

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

<tr>

<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_7">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_7">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_7">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="unhide_row_7">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_13">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Graph Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>???</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_7">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_7">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>

<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>

<h3 id="widget_7">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_7">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_7">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="bringfiguretofront">BringFigureToFront</h3>
<p>Changes Z-order of figures on the Graph.  Brings the indicated figure to the front of all other drawn figures</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">BringFigureToFront</span>(figure)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>figure</td>
<td>value returned by tkinter when creating the figure / drawing</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="deletefigure">DeleteFigure</h3>
<p>Remove from the Graph the figure represented by id. The id is given to you anytime you call a drawing primitive</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">DeleteFigure</span>(id)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>id</td>
<td>the id returned to you when calling one of the drawing methods</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="drawarc">DrawArc</h3>
<p>Draws different types of arcs.  Uses a "bounding box" to define location</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">DrawArc(top_left,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">bottom_right,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">extent,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">start_angle,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">style</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">arc_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"black",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">line_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">1,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">fill_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>top_left</td>
<td>the top left point of bounding rectangle</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>bottom_right</td>
<td>the bottom right point of bounding rectangle</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>extent</td>
<td>Andle to end drawing. Used in conjunction with start_angle</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>start_angle</td>
<td>Angle to begin drawing. Used in conjunction with extent</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>style</td>
<td>Valid choices are One of these Style strings- 'pieslice', 'chord', 'arc', 'first', 'last', 'butt', 'projecting', 'round', 'bevel', 'miter'</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>arc_color</td>
<td>color to draw arc with</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>fill_color</td>
<td>color to fill the area</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>id returned from tkinter that you'll need if you want to manipulate the arc</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="drawcircle">DrawCircle</h3>
<p>Draws a circle, cenetered at the location provided.  Can set the fill and outline colors</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">DrawCircle(center_location,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">radius,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">fill_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">line_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"black",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">line_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">1)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>center_location</td>
<td>Center location using USER'S coordinate system</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>radius</td>
<td>Radius in user's coordinate values.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>fill_color</td>
<td>color of the point to draw</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>line_color</td>
<td>color of the outer line that goes around the circle (sorry, can't set thickness)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>line_width</td>
<td>width of the line around the circle, the outline, in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>id returned from tkinter that you'll need if you want to manipulate the circle</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="drawimage">DrawImage</h3>
<p>Places an image onto your canvas.  It's a really important method for this element as it enables so much</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">DrawImage(filename = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    data = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>filename</td>
<td>if image is in a file, path and filename for the image. (GIF and PNG only!)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>data</td>
<td>if image is in Base64 format or raw? format then use instead of filename</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>the (x,y) location to place image's top left corner</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>id returned from tkinter that you'll need if you want to manipulate the image</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="drawline">DrawLine</h3>
<p>Draws a line from one point to another point using USER'S coordinates. Can set the color and width of line</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">DrawLine</span>(point_from,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">point_to</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"black"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">width</span> = <span class="hljs-number">1</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>point_from</td>
<td>Starting point for line</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>point_to</td>
<td>Ending point for line</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>color</td>
<td>Color of the line</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>width</td>
<td>width of line in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>id returned from tktiner or None if user closed the window. id is used when you</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="drawoval">DrawOval</h3>
<p>Draws an oval based on coordinates in user coordinate system. Provide the location of a "bounding rectangle"</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">DrawOval(top_left,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">bottom_right,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">fill_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">line_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">line_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">1)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>top_left</td>
<td>the top left point of bounding rectangle</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>bottom_right</td>
<td>the bottom right point of bounding rectangle</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>fill_color</td>
<td>color of the interrior</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>line_color</td>
<td>color of outline of oval</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>line_width</td>
<td>width of the line around the oval, the outline, in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>id returned from tkinter that you'll need if you want to manipulate the oval</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

    <span class="hljs-attribute">size</span> = <span class="hljs-number">2</span>,

<h3 id="drawtext">DrawText</h3>
<p>Draw some text on your graph.  This is how you label graph number lines for example</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">DrawText(text,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">location,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"black",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">font</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">angle</span> = <span class="hljs-string">0,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">text_location</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"center")</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>text to display</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>location to place first letter</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>color</td>
<td>text color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>angle</td>
<td>Angle 0 to 360 to draw the text. Zero represents horizontal text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>enum</td>
<td>text_location</td>
<td>"anchor" location for the text. Values start with TEXT_LOCATION_</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>id returned from tkinter that you'll need if you want to manipulate the text</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="move_1">Move</h3>
<p>Moves the entire drawing area (the canvas) by some delta from the current position.  Units are indicated in your coordinate system indicated number of ticks in your coordinate system</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">Move</span>(x_direction, y_direction)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>x_direction</td>
<td>how far to move in the "X" direction in your coordinates</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>y_direction</td>
<td>how far to move in the "Y" direction in your coordinates</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="movefigure">MoveFigure</h3>

    y_direction)

<h3 id="relocatefigure">RelocateFigure</h3>
<p>Move a previously made figure to an arbitrary (x,y) location. This differs from the Move methods because it
uses absolute coordinates versus relative for Move</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">RelocateFigure</span>(figure,
    x,
    y)
</code></pre>

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>id</td>
<td>figure</td>
<td>Previously obtained figure-id. These are returned from all Draw methods</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>x</td>
<td>location on X axis (in user coords) to move the upper left corner of the figure</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>y</td>
<td>location on Y axis (in user coords) to move the upper left corner of the figure</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h2 id="horizontalseparator-element">HorizontalSeparator Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs scss">Horizontal Separator Element draws <span class="hljs-selector-tag">a</span> Horizontal line at the given location.
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">HorizontalSeparator(color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>color</td>
<td>Color of the line. Defaults to theme's text color. Can be name or #RRGGBB format</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_8">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_8">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_8">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_8">get_next_focus</h3>

<h3 id="get_size_8">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_8">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_8">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_8">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_6">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_6">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_8">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_8">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_8">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_8">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_8">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_8">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_tooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_8">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">unbind</span>(bind_string)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unhide_row_8">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="visible_8">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_8">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_8">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_8">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_8">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="setfocus_8">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>

</code></pre>

<tr>
<th>Type</th>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h2 id="image-element">Image Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">Image Element <span class="hljs-operator">-</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">show</span> an image <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> the window. Should be a GIF <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> a PNG <span class="hljs-keyword">only</span>
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Image(source = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    filename = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    data = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    subsample = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    zoom = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    right_click_menu = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    expand_x = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    enable_events = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes or None</td>
<td>source</td>
<td>A filename or a base64 bytes. Will automatically detect the type and fill in filename or data for you.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td>filename</td>
<td>image filename if there is a button image. GIFs and PNGs only.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str or None</td>
<td>data</td>
<td>Raw or Base64 representation of the image to put on button. Choose either filename or data</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(width, height) size of image in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>subsample</td>
<td>amount to reduce the size of the image. Divides the size by this number. 2=1/2, 3=1/3, 4=1/4, etc</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>zoom</td>
<td>amount to increase the size of the image.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>Turns on the element specific events. For an Image element, the event is "image clicked"</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_9">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_9">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_9">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_9">get_next_focus</h3>
<p>Gets the next element that should get focus after this element.</p>
<p><code>get_next_focus()</code></p>

<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Element)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Element that will get focus after this one</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="get_size_9">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_9">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_9">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_9">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_7">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_7">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_9">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_9">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_9">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)

<h3 id="set_focus_9">set_focus</h3>

<h3 id="unbind_9">unbind</h3>

</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<h3 id="unhide_row_9">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_14">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Image Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior.
To clear an image that's been displayed, call with NONE of the options set.  A blank update call will
delete the previously shown image.</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(source <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    filename <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    data <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    subsample <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    zoom <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes or None</td>
<td>source</td>
<td>A filename or a base64 bytes. Will automatically detect the type and fill in filename or data for you.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>filename</td>
<td>filename to the new image to display.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or tkPhotoImage</td>
<td>data</td>
<td>Base64 encoded string OR a tk.PhotoImage object</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[int,int]</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(width, height) size of image in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>subsample</td>
<td>amount to reduce the size of the image. Divides the size by this number. 2=1/2, 3=1/3, 4=1/4, etc</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>zoom</td>
<td>amount to increase the size of the image</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_animation">update_animation</h3>
<p>Show an Animated GIF. Call the function as often as you like. The function will determine when to show the next frame and will automatically advance to the next frame at the right time.
NOTE - does NOT perform a sleep call to delay</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">update_animation</span>(source, time_between_frames = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes or None</td>
<td>source</td>
<td>Filename or Base64 encoded string containing Animated GIF</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>time_between_frames</td>
<td>Number of milliseconds to wait between showing frames</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_animation_no_buffering">update_animation_no_buffering</h3>
<p>Show an Animated GIF. Call the function as often as you like. The function will determine when to show the next frame and will automatically advance to the next frame at the right time.
NOTE - does NOT perform a sleep call to delay</p>

<h3 id="visible_9">visible</h3>

<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>

<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_9">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_9">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_9">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="setfocus_9">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">SetFocus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_9">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetTooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_15">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Image Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior.
To clear an image that's been displayed, call with NONE of the options set.  A blank update call will
delete the previously shown image.</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(source <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    filename <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    data <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    subsample <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    zoom <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes or None</td>
<td>source</td>
<td>A filename or a base64 bytes. Will automatically detect the type and fill in filename or data for you.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>filename</td>
<td>filename to the new image to display.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or tkPhotoImage</td>
<td>data</td>
<td>Base64 encoded string OR a tk.PhotoImage object</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[int,int]</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(width, height) size of image in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>subsample</td>
<td>amount to reduce the size of the image. Divides the size by this number. 2=1/2, 3=1/3, 4=1/4, etc</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>zoom</td>
<td>amount to increase the size of the image</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h2 id="input-element">Input Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs vbnet">Display a <span class="hljs-type">single</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">text</span> input field.  Based <span class="hljs-keyword">on</span> the tkinter Widget `Entry`
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Input(default_text = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    disabled = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    password_char = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    justification = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    border_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    change_submits = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_events = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    do_not_clear = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    focus = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    use_readonly_for_disable = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    readonly = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    disabled_readonly_background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    disabled_readonly_text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    selected_text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    selected_background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    expand_x = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    right_click_menu = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>default_text</td>
<td>Text initially shown in the input box as a default value(Default value = ''). Will automatically be converted to string</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or  (int, None) or int</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>w=characters-wide, h=rows-high. If an int is supplied rather than a tuple, then a tuple is created width=int supplied and heigh=1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>char</td>
<td>password_char</td>
<td>Password character if this is a password field (Default value = '')</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>justification</td>
<td>justification for data display. Valid choices - left, right, center</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background in one of the color formats</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>border_width</td>
<td>width of border around element in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>change_submits</td>
<td>* DEPRICATED DO NOT USE. Use <code>enable_events</code> instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>If True then changes to this element are immediately reported as an event. Use this instead of change_submits (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>do_not_clear</td>
<td>If False then the field will be set to blank after ANY event (button, any event) (Default = True)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>focus</td>
<td>Determines if initial focus should go to this element.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element. Normally (horizontal pixels, vertical pixels) but can be split apart further into ((horizontal left, horizontal right), (vertical above, vertical below)). If int is given, then converted to tuple (int, int) with the value provided duplicated</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>use_readonly_for_disable</td>
<td>If True (the default) tkinter state set to 'readonly'. Otherwise state set to 'disabled'</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>readonly</td>
<td>If True tkinter state set to 'readonly'. Use this in place of use_readonly_for_disable as another way of achieving readonly. Note cannot set BOTH readonly and disabled as tkinter only supplies a single flag</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>disabled_readonly_background_color</td>
<td>If state is set to readonly or disabled, the color to use for the background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>disabled_readonly_text_color</td>
<td>If state is set to readonly or disabled, the color to use for the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>selected_text_color</td>
<td>Color of text when it is selected (using mouse or control+A, etc)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>selected_background_color</td>
<td>Color of background when it is selected (using mouse or control+A, etc)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element (Default = True)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_10">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_10">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_10">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_4">get</h3>
<p>Read and return the current value of the input element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p><code>get()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(str)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>current value of Input field or '' if error encountered</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_10">get_next_focus</h3>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

<tr>
<td>(Element)</td>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_previous_focus_10">get_previous_focus</h3>

<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>

<td>(Element)</td>

<h3 id="get_size_10">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_10">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_10">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_10">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_8">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_8">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_10">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_10">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_10">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_10">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_10">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_10">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>

<h3 id="set_vscroll_position_3">set_vscroll_position</h3>

<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_vscroll_position</span>(percent_from_top)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>percent_from_top</td>
<td>From 0 to 1.0, the percentage from the top to move scrollbar to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_10">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">unbind</span>(bind_string)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>

<td>str</td>
