<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unhide_row_10">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_16">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Input Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior.
Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">select</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    move_cursor_to <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> "end",
    password_char <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    paste <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    readonly <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>new text to display as default text in Input field</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element (sets Entry Widget to readonly or normal)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>select</td>
<td>if True, then the text will be selected</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>change visibility of element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>change color of text being typed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>change color of the background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or str</td>
<td>move_cursor_to</td>
<td>Moves the cursor to a particular offset. Defaults to 'end'</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>password_char</td>
<td>Password character if this is a password field</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>paste</td>
<td>If True "Pastes" the value into the element rather than replacing the entire element. If anything is selected it is replaced. The text is inserted at the current cursor location.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>readonly</td>
<td>if True make element readonly (user cannot change any choices). Enables the element if either choice are made.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_10">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_10">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_10">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_10">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_10">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="get_5">Get</h3>
<p>Read and return the current value of the input element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p><code>Get()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(str)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>current value of Input field or '' if error encountered</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="setfocus_10">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">SetFocus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_10">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>

<h3 id="update_17">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Input Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior.
Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">select</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    move_cursor_to <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> "end",
    password_char <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    paste <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    readonly <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>new text to display as default text in Input field</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element (sets Entry Widget to readonly or normal)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>select</td>
<td>if True, then the text will be selected</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>change visibility of element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>change color of text being typed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>change color of the background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or str</td>
<td>move_cursor_to</td>
<td>Moves the cursor to a particular offset. Defaults to 'end'</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>password_char</td>
<td>Password character if this is a password field</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>paste</td>
<td>If True "Pastes" the value into the element rather than replacing the entire element. If anything is selected it is replaced. The text is inserted at the current cursor location.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>readonly</td>
<td>if True make element readonly (user cannot change any choices). Enables the element if either choice are made.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="listbox-element">Listbox Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">A List Box.  Provide a list <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> the <span class="hljs-keyword">user</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> choose <span class="hljs-keyword">one</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> more of.   <span class="hljs-keyword">Returns</span> a list <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> selected <span class="hljs-keyword">rows</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">when</span> a window.read() <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> executed.
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">Listbox(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span>,
    default_values <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    select_mode <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    change_submits <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_events <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    bind_return_key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    s <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    justification <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    auto_size_text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    no_scrollbar <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    horizontal_scroll <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    highlight_background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    highlight_text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_trough_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_arrow_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_width <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_arrow_width <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_frame_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sbar_relief <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    k <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    pad <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    p <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    tooltip <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    expand_x <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    right_click_menu <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Any] or Tuple[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>list of values to display. Can be any type including mixed types as long as they have <strong>str</strong> method</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td>default_values</td>
<td>which values should be initially selected</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>[enum]</td>
<td>select_mode</td>
<td>Select modes are used to determine if only 1 item can be selected or multiple and how they can be selected. Valid choices begin with "LISTBOX_SELECT_MODE_" and include: LISTBOX_SELECT_MODE_SINGLE LISTBOX_SELECT_MODE_MULTIPLE LISTBOX_SELECT_MODE_BROWSE LISTBOX_SELECT_MODE_EXTENDED</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>change_submits</td>
<td>DO NOT USE. Only listed for backwards compat - Use enable_events instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>Turns on the element specific events. Listbox generates events when an item is clicked</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>bind_return_key</td>
<td>If True, then the return key will cause a the Listbox to generate an event when return key is pressed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or  (int, None) or int</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>w=characters-wide, h=rows-high. If an int instead of a tuple is supplied, then height is auto-set to 1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>justification</td>
<td>justification for items in listbox. Valid choices - left, right, center. Default is left. NOTE - on some older versions of tkinter, not available</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_text</td>
<td>True if element should be the same size as the contents</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_scrollbar</td>
<td>Controls if a scrollbar should be shown. If True, no scrollbar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>horizontal_scroll</td>
<td>Controls if a horizontal scrollbar should be shown. If True a horizontal scrollbar will be shown in addition to vertical</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>highlight_background_color</td>
<td>color of the background when an item is selected. Defaults to normal text color (a reverse look)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>highlight_text_color</td>
<td>color of the text when an item is selected. Defaults to the normal background color (a rerverse look)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_trough_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the trough</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_background_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the background of the arrow buttons at the ends AND the color of the "thumb" (the thing you grab and slide). Switches to arrow color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the arrow at the ends of the scrollbar (it looks like a button). Switches to background color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width of the arrow on the scrollbar. It will potentially impact the overall width of the scrollbar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_frame_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar Color of frame around scrollbar (available only on some ttk themes)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_relief</td>
<td>Scrollbar relief that will be used for the "thumb" of the scrollbar (the thing you grab that slides). Should be a constant that is defined at starting with "RELIEF_" - RELIEF_RAISED, RELIEF_SUNKEN, RELIEF_FLAT, RELIEF_RIDGE, RELIEF_GROOVE, RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_11">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_11">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_11">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_6">get</h3>
<p>Returns the list of items currently selected in this listbox.  It should be identical
to the value you would receive when performing a window.read() call.</p>
<p><code>get()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The list of currently selected items. The actual items are returned, not the indexes</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_indexes">get_indexes</h3>

<h3 id="get_size_11">get_size</h3>

<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_11">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_11">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_11">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_9">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_9">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

<tr>

<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_11">metadata</h3>

<th>Meaning</th>

<h3 id="set_cursor_11">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_11">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>

</code></pre>

</tr>

<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_11">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>

</code></pre>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="unhide_row_11">unhide_row</h3>

        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>

</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_18">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Listbox Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior
Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    set_to_index <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    scroll_to_index <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    select_mode <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>new list of choices to be shown to user</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or list or tuple</td>
<td>set_to_index</td>
<td>highlights the item(s) indicated. If parm is an int one entry will be set. If is a list, then each entry in list is highlighted</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>scroll_to_index</td>
<td>scroll the listbox so that this index is the first shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>select_mode</td>
<td>changes the select mode according to tkinter's listbox widget</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_11">visible</h3>

<h3 id="widget_11">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_11">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_11">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="getindexes">GetIndexes</h3>
<p>Returns the items currently selected as a list of indexes</p>
<p><code>GetIndexes()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[int]</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>A list of offsets into values that is currently selected</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="getlistvalues">GetListValues</h3>
<p>Returns list of Values provided by the user in the user's format</p>

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>List of values. Can be any / mixed types -&gt; []</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="setfocus_11">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>

</code></pre>

<tr>

<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_11">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetTooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="setvalue">SetValue</h3>
<p>Set listbox highlighted choices</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetValue</span>(values)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Any] or Tuple[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>new values to choose based on previously set values</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_19">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Listbox Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior
Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    set_to_index <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    scroll_to_index <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    select_mode <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>new list of choices to be shown to user</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or list or tuple</td>
<td>set_to_index</td>
<td>highlights the item(s) indicated. If parm is an int one entry will be set. If is a list, then each entry in list is highlighted</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>scroll_to_index</td>
<td>scroll the listbox so that this index is the first shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>select_mode</td>
<td>changes the select mode according to tkinter's listbox widget</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="menu-element">Menu Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs coffeescript">Menu Element <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> the Element that provides a Menu Bar that goes across the top <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> the <span class="hljs-built_in">window</span>, just below titlebar.
Here <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> an example layout.  The <span class="hljs-string">"&amp;"</span> are shortcut keys ALT+key.
Is a List <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> -  <span class="hljs-string">"Item String"</span> + List
Where Item <span class="hljs-built_in">String</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> what will be displayed <span class="hljs-literal">on</span> the Menubar itself.
The List that follows the item represents the items that are shown <span class="hljs-keyword">then</span> Menu item <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> clicked
Notice how an <span class="hljs-string">"entry"</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> a mennu can be a list which means it branches out <span class="hljs-keyword">and</span> shows another menu, etc. (resursive)
menu_def = [[<span class="hljs-string">'&amp;File'</span>, [<span class="hljs-string">'!&amp;Open'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'&amp;Save::savekey'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'---'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'&amp;Properties'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'E&amp;xit'</span>]],
            [<span class="hljs-string">'!&amp;Edit'</span>, [<span class="hljs-string">'!&amp;Paste'</span>, [<span class="hljs-string">'Special'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'Normal'</span>, ], <span class="hljs-string">'Undo'</span>], ],
            [<span class="hljs-string">'&amp;Debugger'</span>, [<span class="hljs-string">'Popout'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'Launch Debugger'</span>]],
            [<span class="hljs-string">'&amp;Toolbar'</span>, [<span class="hljs-string">'Command &amp;1'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'Command &amp;2'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'Command &amp;3'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'Command &amp;4'</span>]],
            [<span class="hljs-string">'&amp;Help'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'&amp;About...'</span>], ]
Important Note!  The colors, font, look <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> the Menubar itself cannot be changed, only the menus shown AFTER clicking the menubar
can be changed.  If you want to change the style/colors the Menubar, <span class="hljs-keyword">then</span> you will have to use the MenubarCustom element.
Finally, <span class="hljs-string">"keys"</span> can be added to entries so make them unique.  The <span class="hljs-string">"Save"</span> entry has a key associated <span class="hljs-keyword">with</span> it. You
can see it has a <span class="hljs-string">"::"</span> which signifies the beginning <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> a key.  The user will <span class="hljs-keyword">not</span> see the key portion <span class="hljs-keyword">when</span> the
menu <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> shown.  The key portion <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> returned <span class="hljs-keyword">as</span> part <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> the event.
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Menu(menu_definition,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    disabled_text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    tearoff = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Tuple[str, List[str]]]</td>
<td>menu_definition</td>
<td>The Menu definition specified using lists (docs explain the format)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of the background of menus, NOT the Menubar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>text color for menus, NOT the Menubar. Can be in #RRGGBB format or a color name "black".</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>disabled_text_color</td>
<td>color to use for text when item in submenu, not the menubar itself, is disabled. Can be in #RRGGBB format or a color name "black"</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>Not used in the tkinter port</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None)</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>tearoff</td>
<td>if True, then can tear the menu off from the window ans use as a floating window. Very cool effect</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. of submenus. Does NOT apply to the Menubar itself. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_12">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_12">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_12">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_12">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_12">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_12">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_10">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_10">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_12">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_12">property: metadata</h4>

<h3 id="set_cursor_12">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_12">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_12">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_12">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_tooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>

</table>
<h3 id="unbind_12">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>

</code></pre>

<h3 id="unhide_row_12">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_20">update</h3>
<p>Update a menubar - can change the menu definition and visibility.  The entire menu has to be specified</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(menu_definition <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Tuple[str, List[str]]]</td>
<td>menu_definition</td>
<td>The menu definition list</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_12">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_12">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_12">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_12">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_12">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="setfocus_12">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">SetFocus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_12">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetTooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_21">Update</h3>
<p>Update a menubar - can change the menu definition and visibility.  The entire menu has to be specified</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(menu_definition <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Tuple[str, List[str]]]</td>
<td>menu_definition</td>
<td>The menu definition list</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="menubarcustom-element">MenubarCustom Element</h2>
<p>Note that while the MenubarCustom is an element, it is implemented using a function.
It is actually a "compound element" that consists of several elements combined into a single Column element.
See the Column element to get a list of method calls available.  The function returns a Column element.</p>
<p>A custom Menubar that replaces the OS provided Menubar</p>
<p>Why?
Two reasons - 1. they look great (see custom titlebar) 2. if you have a custom titlebar, then you have to use a custom menubar if you want a menubar</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">MenubarCustom(menu_definition,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">disabled_text_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">bar_font</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">font</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">tearoff</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">pad</span> = <span class="hljs-string">0,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">p</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">text_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">bar_background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">bar_text_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">key</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">k</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Tuple[str, List[str]]]</td>
<td>menu_definition</td>
<td>The Menu definition specified using lists (docs explain the format)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>disabled_text_color</td>
<td>color to use for text when item is disabled. Can be in #RRGGBB format or a color name "black"</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>bar_font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size to be used for the chars in the bar itself</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size to be used for the menu items</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>tearoff</td>
<td>if True, then can tear the menu off from the window ans use as a floating window. Very cool effect</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int). TIP - 0 will make flush with titlebar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color to use for background of the menus that are displayed after making a section. Can be in #RRGGBB format or a color name "black". Defaults to the color of the bar text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color to use for the text of the many items in the displayed menus. Can be in #RRGGBB format or a color name "black". Defaults to the bar background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bar_background_color</td>
<td>color to use for the menubar. Can be in #RRGGBB format or a color name "black". Defaults to theme's button text color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bar_text_color</td>
<td>color to use for the menu items text when item is disabled. Can be in #RRGGBB format or a color name "black". Defaults to theme's button background color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="multiline-element">Multiline Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs lua">Multiline Element - Display <span class="hljs-keyword">and</span>/<span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">read</span> multiple <span class="hljs-built_in">lines</span> of text.  This is both an <span class="hljs-built_in">input</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">and</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">output</span> element.
Other PySimpleGUI ports have a separate MultilineInput <span class="hljs-keyword">and</span> MultilineOutput elements.  May want to split this
one up <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> the future too.
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Multiline(default_text = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    enter_submits = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    disabled = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    autoscroll = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    border_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    auto_size_text = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    selected_text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    selected_background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    horizontal_scroll = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    change_submits = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_events = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    do_not_clear = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    write_only = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    auto_refresh = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    reroute_stdout = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    reroute_stderr = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    reroute_cprint = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    echo_stdout_stderr = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    focus = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    justification = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_scrollbar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    wrap_lines = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sbar_trough_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sbar_background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sbar_arrow_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sbar_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sbar_arrow_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sbar_frame_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sbar_relief = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    expand_x = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    rstrip = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    right_click_menu = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>default_text</td>
<td>Initial text to show</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enter_submits</td>
<td>if True, the Window.read call will return is enter key is pressed in this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>autoscroll</td>
<td>If True the contents of the element will automatically scroll as more data added to the end</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>border_width</td>
<td>width of border around element in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(w, h) w=characters-wide, h=rows-high. If an int instead of a tuple is supplied, then height is auto-set to 1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_text</td>
<td>if True will size the element to match the length of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>selected_text_color</td>
<td>Color of text when it is selected (using mouse or control+A, etc)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>selected_background_color</td>
<td>Color of background when it is selected (using mouse or control+A, etc)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>horizontal_scroll</td>
<td>Controls if a horizontal scrollbar should be shown. If True a horizontal scrollbar will be shown in addition to vertical</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>change_submits</td>
<td>DO NOT USE. Only listed for backwards compat - Use enable_events instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>If True then any key press that happens when the element has focus will generate an event.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>do_not_clear</td>
<td>if False the element will be cleared any time the Window.read call returns</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>write_only</td>
<td>If True then no entry will be added to the values dictionary when the window is read</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_refresh</td>
<td>If True then anytime the element is updated, the window will be refreshed so that the change is immediately displayed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>reroute_stdout</td>
<td>If True then all output to stdout will be output to this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>reroute_stderr</td>
<td>If True then all output to stderr will be output to this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>reroute_cprint</td>
<td>If True your cprint calls will output to this element. It's the same as you calling cprint_set_output_destination</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>echo_stdout_stderr</td>
<td>If True then output to stdout and stderr will be output to this element AND also to the normal console location</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>focus</td>
<td>if True initial focus will go to this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>justification</td>
<td>text justification. left, right, center. Can use single characters l, r, c.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_scrollbar</td>
<td>If False then a vertical scrollbar will be shown (the default)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>wrap_lines</td>
<td>If True, the lines will be wrapped automatically. Other parms affect this setting, but this one will override them all. Default is it does nothing and uses previous settings for wrapping.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_trough_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the trough</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_background_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the background of the arrow buttons at the ends AND the color of the "thumb" (the thing you grab and slide). Switches to arrow color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the arrow at the ends of the scrollbar (it looks like a button). Switches to background color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width of the arrow on the scrollbar. It will potentially impact the overall width of the scrollbar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_frame_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar Color of frame around scrollbar (available only on some ttk themes)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_relief</td>
<td>Scrollbar relief that will be used for the "thumb" of the scrollbar (the thing you grab that slides). Should be a constant that is defined at starting with "RELIEF_" - RELIEF_RAISED, RELIEF_SUNKEN, RELIEF_FLAT, RELIEF_RIDGE, RELIEF_GROOVE, RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>rstrip</td>
<td>If True the value returned in will have whitespace stripped from the right side</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_13">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_13">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_13">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_7">get</h3>
<p>Return current contents of the Multiline Element</p>
<p><code>get()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(str)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>current contents of the Multiline Element (used as an input type of Multiline</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_13">get_next_focus</h3>
<p>Gets the next element that should get focus after this element.</p>

<thead>

<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Element)</td>

</tr>

<h3 id="get_previous_focus_13">get_previous_focus</h3>
<p>Gets the element that should get focus previous to this element.</p>
<p><code>get_previous_focus()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Element)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Element that should get the focus before this one</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_size_13">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_13">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_13">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_13">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="print">print</h3>
<p>Print like Python normally prints except route the output to a multiline element and also add colors if desired</p>
<p>colors -(str, str) or str.  A combined text/background color definition in a single parameter</p>
<p>There are also "aliases" for text_color, background_color and colors (t, b, c)
t - An alias for color of the text (makes for shorter calls)
b - An alias for the background_color parameter
c - (str, str) - "shorthand" way of specifying color. (foreground, backgrouned)
c - str - can also be a string of the format "foreground on background"  ("white on red")</p>
<p>With the aliases it's possible to write the same print but in more compact ways:
cprint('This will print white text on red background', c=('white', 'red'))
cprint('This will print white text on red background', c='white on red')
cprint('This will print white text on red background', text_color='white', background_color='red')
cprint('This will print white text on red background', t='white', b='red')</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">print(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    end = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sep = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    justification = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    colors = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    t = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    b = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    c = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    autoscroll = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>args</td>
<td>The arguments to print</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>end</td>
<td>The end char to use just like print uses</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sep</td>
<td>The separation character like print uses</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>The color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>The background color of the line</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>justification</td>
<td>text justification. left, right, center. Can use single characters l, r, c. Sets only for this value, not entire element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike for the args being printed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or str, str</td>
<td>colors</td>
<td>Either a tuple or a string that has both the text and background colors. Or just the text color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>t</td>
<td>Color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>b</td>
<td>The background color of the line</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or str, str</td>
<td>c</td>
<td>Either a tuple or a string that has both the text and background colors or just tex color (same as the color parm)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>autoscroll</td>
<td>If True the contents of the element will automatically scroll as more data added to the end</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</code></pre>

<h3 id="set_cursor_13">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="update_22">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Multiline Element. Must call <code>Window.read</code> or set finalize=True when creating window.</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    append <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color_for_value <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color_for_value <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    autoscroll <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    justification <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font_for_value <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>new text to display</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>append</td>
<td>if True then new value will be added onto the end of the current value. if False then contents will be replaced.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike for the entire element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color_for_value</td>
<td>color of the new text being added (the value paramter)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color_for_value</td>
<td>color of the new background of the text being added (the value paramter)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>autoscroll</td>
<td>if True then contents of element are scrolled down when new text is added to the end</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>justification</td>
<td>text justification. left, right, center. Can use single characters l, r, c. Sets only for this value, not entire element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or (str, int)</td>
<td>font_for_value</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike for the value being updated</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
