<h3 id="unhide_row_17">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_30">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the ProgressBar Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior
Now has the ability to modify the count so that the update_bar method is not longer needed separately</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">update(current_count = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-built_in">max</span> = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    bar_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>current_count</td>
<td>sets the current value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>max</td>
<td>changes the max value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>bar_color</td>
<td>The 2 colors that make up a progress bar. Easy to remember which is which if you say "ON" between colors. "red" on "green".</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns True if update was OK.  False means something wrong with window or it was closed</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_bar">update_bar</h3>
<p>DEPRECATED BUT STILL USABLE - has been combined with the normal ProgressBar.update method.
Change what the bar shows by changing the current count and optionally the max count</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">update_bar(current_count, <span class="hljs-built_in">max</span> = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>current_count</td>
<td>sets the current value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>max</td>
<td>changes the max value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_17">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_17">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_17">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_17">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_17">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="setfocus_17">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">SetFocus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_17">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetTooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_31">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the ProgressBar Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior
Now has the ability to modify the count so that the update_bar method is not longer needed separately</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Update(current_count = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-built_in">max</span> = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    bar_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>current_count</td>
<td>sets the current value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>max</td>
<td>changes the max value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>bar_color</td>
<td>The 2 colors that make up a progress bar. Easy to remember which is which if you say "ON" between colors. "red" on "green".</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns True if update was OK.  False means something wrong with window or it was closed</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="updatebar">UpdateBar</h3>
<p>DEPRECATED BUT STILL USABLE - has been combined with the normal ProgressBar.update method.
Change what the bar shows by changing the current count and optionally the max count</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">UpdateBar(current_count, <span class="hljs-built_in">max</span> = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>current_count</td>
<td>sets the current value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>max</td>
<td>changes the max value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="push-element-alias-include-p-and-stretch">Push Element (alias include <code>P</code> and <code>Stretch</code>)</h2>
<p>Not a true element, but a function acting like an element.</p>
<p>These elements <code>Push</code> and <code>VPush</code> as aliases for <code>Stretch</code> and <code>VStretch</code> and are implemented using a function rather than a class.  They're not meant to be manipulated like other elements.  They have a functional role in a layout that is much like the "Layout Helper Functions" (pin, vtop, etc).</p>
<p>The name <code>Stretch</code> originally appeared in the PySimpleGUI APIs when the PySimpleGUIQt port was added.</p>
<p>In the Sept 2021 time-frame, a functioning version of this element appeared in the tkinter port, along with some aliases and a vertical addition.</p>
<p>The PySimpleGUI documentation, demos, etc, will be using the names <code>Push</code> and <code>VPush</code>.</p>
<h3 id="push-style-elements-use">Push-style Elements Use</h3>
<p>These elements modify the placement of other elements inside of containers.  As the name implies, these elements <code>Push</code> and <code>VPush</code> will "push" other elements around.  <code>Push</code> works in the horizontal direction, <code>VPush</code> in the vertical.</p>
<p>A <code>Push</code> element will "push" elements on the row away from it.  If you have 1 <code>Push</code> as the start of a row, then the row will be right-justified.  If you have two <code>Push</code> elements, one as the first element and one as the last element on a row, then the row will be centered.</p>
<p>Acts like a Stretch element found in the Qt port.
Used in a Horizontal fashion.  Placing one on each side of an element will enter the element.
Place one to the left and the element to the right will be right justified.  See VStretch for vertical type</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">Push</span>(background_color = None)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background may be needed because of how this is implemented</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="radio-element">Radio Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">Radio Button Element <span class="hljs-operator">-</span> Used <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> a <span class="hljs-keyword">group</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> other Radio Elements <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> provide <span class="hljs-keyword">user</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">with</span> ability <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">select</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">only</span>
<span class="hljs-number">1</span> choice <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> a list <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> choices.
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">Radio(text,
    group_id,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">default</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    s <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    auto_size_text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    circle_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    k <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    pad <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    p <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    tooltip <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    change_submits <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_events <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    right_click_menu <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    expand_x <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>

<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>

</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>Text to display next to button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>group_id</td>
<td>Groups together multiple Radio Buttons. Any type works</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>default</td>
<td>Set to True for the one element of the group you want initially selected</td>
</tr>

<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state</td>
</tr>

</tr>

<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>

<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>

<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>

</tr>

<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>

<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>

</tr>

<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>

<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_18">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

<td>bind_string</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_17">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_18">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_18">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_18">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_18">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="reset_group">reset_group</h3>
<p>Sets all Radio Buttons in the group to not selected</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">reset_group()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_16">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_16">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_18">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_18">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<tr>

<th>Meaning</th>

<h3 id="set_cursor_18">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_18">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_18">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_18">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_tooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>

<tr>

<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_18">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">unbind</span>(bind_string)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unhide_row_18">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_32">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Radio Button Element. Must call <code>Window.read</code> or <code>Window.finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    circle_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>if True change to selected and set others in group to unselected</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>Text to display next to radio button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text. Note this also changes the color of the selection dot</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>circle_color</td>
<td>color of background of the circle that has the dot selection indicator in it</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_18">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_18">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>

<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_18">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_18">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_18">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="get_11">Get</h3>
<p>A snapshot of the value of Radio Button -&gt; (bool)</p>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h2 id="sizer-element">Sizer Element</h2>
<p>Note that while the Sizer is an element, it is implemented using a function and doesn't have the normal set of element methods.</p>
<p>This element is used to add more space.... more size...to a Container Element or a Window.  They are often better to use than hard-coded sizes on the containers typically.</p>
<p>"Pushes" out the size of whatever it is placed inside of.  This includes Columns, Frames, Tabs and Windows</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">Sizer</span>(h_pixels = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>, v_pixels = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>h_pixels</td>
<td>number of horizontal pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>v_pixels</td>
<td>number of vertical pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Column)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>(Column) A column element that has a pad setting set according to parameters</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="sizegrip-element">Sizegrip Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">    Sizegrip element will be added <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> the bottom <span class="hljs-keyword">right</span> corner <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> your window.
    It should be placed <span class="hljs-keyword">on</span> the <span class="hljs-keyword">last</span> <span class="hljs-type">row</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> your <span class="hljs-keyword">window</span> along <span class="hljs-keyword">with</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">any</span> other elements <span class="hljs-keyword">on</span> that row.
    The color will <span class="hljs-keyword">match</span> the theme<span class="hljs-string">'s background color.
</span></code></pre>
<p>Sizegrip Element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-meta">Sizegrip(background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">pad</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">p</span> = <span class="hljs-string">(0, 0),</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">key</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">k</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color to use for the background of the grip</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_19">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_19">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_19">get_next_focus</h3>

<h3 id="get_size_19">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>

<th>Name</th>

</tr>
</thead>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_19">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_19">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_19">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_17">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_17">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_19">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_19">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_19">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_19">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_19">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_19">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_tooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_vscroll_position_8">set_vscroll_position</h3>
<p>Attempts to set the vertical scroll postition for an element's Widget</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_vscroll_position</span>(percent_from_top)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>percent_from_top</td>
<td>From 0 to 1.0, the percentage from the top to move scrollbar to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_19">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">unbind</span>(bind_string)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unhide_row_19">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_34">update</h3>
<p>A dummy update call.  This will only be called if an element hasn't implemented an update method
It is provided here for docstring purposes.  If you got here by browing code via PyCharm, know
that this is not the function that will be called.  Your actual element's update method will be called.</p>
<p>If you call update, you must call window.refresh if you want the change to happen prior to your next
window.read() call. Normally uou don't do this as the window.read call is likely going to happen next.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">update</span>(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> or N object&gt;, kwargs)
</code></pre>
<h3 id="visible_19">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_19">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_19">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_19">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="slider-element">Slider Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs nginx"><span class="hljs-attribute">A</span> slider, horizontal or vertical
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Slider(<span class="hljs-built_in">range</span> = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    default_value = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    resolution = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    tick_interval = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    orientation = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    disable_number_display = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    border_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    relief = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    change_submits = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_events = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    disabled = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    trough_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    expand_x = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float]</td>
<td>range</td>
<td>slider's range (min value, max value)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>default_value</td>
<td>starting value for the slider</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>resolution</td>
<td>the smallest amount the slider can be moved</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>tick_interval</td>
<td>how often a visible tick should be shown next to slider</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>orientation</td>
<td>'horizontal' or 'vertical' ('h' or 'v' also work)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disable_number_display</td>
<td>if True no number will be displayed by the Slider Element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>border_width</td>
<td>width of border around element in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td>relief</td>
<td>relief style. Use constants - RELIEF_RAISED RELIEF_SUNKEN RELIEF_FLAT RELIEF_RIDGE RELIEF_GROOVE RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>change_submits</td>
<td>* DEPRICATED DO NOT USE. Use <code>enable_events</code> instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>If True then moving the slider will generate an Event</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(l=length chars/rows, w=width pixels)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None)</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of slider's background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the slider's text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>trough_color</td>
<td>color of the slider's trough</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_20">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_18">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_20">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_20">get_next_focus</h3>
<p>Gets the next element that should get focus after this element.</p>

</tr>

<td>(Element)</td>

</tr>

</table>

<th>Type</th>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

</tbody>

<h3 id="get_size_20">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_20">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_20">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_20">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_18">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_18">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_20">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_20">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_20">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_20">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_20">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_20">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_tooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_20">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">unbind</span>(bind_string)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<h3 id="unhide_row_20">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_35">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Slider Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">range</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>sets current slider value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float</td>
<td>range</td>
<td>Sets a new range for slider</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_20">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_20">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_20">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_20">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_19">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="setfocus_19">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">SetFocus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_19">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetTooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_36">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Slider Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">range</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>sets current slider value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or Tuple[float, float</td>
<td>range</td>
<td>Sets a new range for slider</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>disable or enable state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="spin-element">Spin Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs vbnet">A spinner <span class="hljs-keyword">with</span> up/down buttons <span class="hljs-built_in">and</span> a <span class="hljs-type">single</span> line <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">text</span>. Choose <span class="hljs-number">1</span> values <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> list
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">Spin(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span>,
    initial_value <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    disabled <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    change_submits <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_events <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    readonly <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    size <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    s <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>),
    auto_size_text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    bind_return_key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    k <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    pad <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    p <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    wrap <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    tooltip <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    right_click_menu <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    expand_x <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[Any] or List[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>List of valid values</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>initial_value</td>
<td>Initial item to show in window. Choose from list of values supplied</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>change_submits</td>
<td>DO NOT USE. Only listed for backwards compat - Use enable_events instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>Turns on the element specific events. Spin events happen when an item changes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>readonly</td>
<td>If True, then users cannot type in values. Only values from the values list are allowed.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(w, h) w=characters-wide, h=rows-high. If an int instead of a tuple is supplied, then height is auto-set to 1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_text</td>
<td>if True will size the element to match the length of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>bind_return_key</td>
<td>If True, then the return key will cause a the element to generate an event when return key is pressed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>wrap</td>
<td>Determines if the values should "Wrap". Default is False. If True, when reaching last value, will continue back to the first value.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_21">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_19">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_21">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_12">get</h3>
<p>Return the current chosen value showing in spinbox.
This value will be the same as what was provided as list of choices.  If list items are ints, then the
item returned will be an int (not a string)</p>
<p><code>get()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>

<tr>

<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The currently visible entry</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="get_size_21">get_size</h3>

<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_21">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_21">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_21">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_19">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_19">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>

<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>

</tr>
</tbody>

<h3 id="metadata_21">metadata</h3>

<h3 id="set_cursor_21">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_21">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_21">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>

</code></pre>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_21">set_tooltip</h3>
