<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_25">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_25">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_25">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_23">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_23">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_25">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_25">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_25">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_25">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_25">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_25">set_tooltip</h3>

<h3 id="unhide_row_25">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_43">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Table Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    num_rows <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    select_rows <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    alternating_row_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    row_colors <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[str or int or float]]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>A new 2-dimensional table to show</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>num_rows</td>
<td>How many rows to display at a time</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>if True then will be visible</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[int]</td>
<td>select_rows</td>
<td>List of rows to select as if user did</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>alternating_row_color</td>
<td>the color to make every other row</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[Tuple[int, str] or Tuple[Int, str, str]]</td>
<td>row_colors</td>
<td>list of tuples of (row, background color) OR (row, foreground color, background color). Changes the colors of listed rows to the color(s) provided (note the optional foreground color)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_25">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_25">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_25">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_25">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_24">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="get_17">Get</h3>
<p>Get the selected rows using tktiner's selection method.  Experimenting with this change....</p>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Any]]</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current table values</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="update_44">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Table Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    num_rows <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    select_rows <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    alternating_row_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    row_colors <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>

<hr>
<h2 id="text-element">Text Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs scss">Text - <span class="hljs-attribute">Display</span> some text in the window.  Usually this means <span class="hljs-selector-tag">a</span> single line of text.  However, the text can also be multiple lines.  If multi-lined there are no scroll bars.
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Text(text = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    auto_size_text = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    click_submits = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    enable_events = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    relief = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    border_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    justification = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    right_click_menu = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    expand_x = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>The text to display. Can include /n to achieve multiple lines. Will convert (optional) parameter into a string</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or  (int, None) or (None, None) or (int, ) or int</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(w, h) w=characters-wide, h=rows-high. If an int instead of a tuple is supplied, then height is auto-set to 1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or  (int, None) or (None, None) or (int, ) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_text</td>
<td>if True size of the Text Element will be sized to fit the string provided in 'text' parm</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>click_submits</td>
<td>DO NOT USE. Only listed for backwards compat - Use enable_events instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>Turns on the element specific events. Text events happen when the text is clicked</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>relief</td>
<td>relief style around the text. Values are same as progress meter relief values. Should be a constant that is defined at starting with RELIEF - RELIEF_RAISED, RELIEF_SUNKEN, RELIEF_FLAT, RELIEF_RIDGE, RELIEF_GROOVE, RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>border_width</td>
<td>number of pixels for the border (if using a relief)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>justification</td>
<td>how string should be aligned within space provided by size. Valid choices = <code>left</code>, <code>right</code>, <code>center</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab</td>
<td>If True can grab this element and move the window around. Default is False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_26">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_26">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_26">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_26">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_26">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_24">key</h3>

<h3 id="set_cursor_26">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_45">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Text Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>new text to show</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_26">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_26">property: visible</h4>

<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_25">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>

<h3 id="update_46">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Text Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>

when made visible.</p>

<hr>
<h2 id="titlebar-element">Titlebar Element</h2>
<p>Note that while the Titlebar is an element, it is implemented using a function.</p>
<p>It is actually a "compound element" that consists of several elements combined into a single Column element.
See the Column element to get a list of method calls available.  The function returns a Column element.  This type of construct is referred to as "User Defined Elements" in the documentation and tutorials.</p>
<p>A custom titlebar that replaces the OS provided titlebar, thus giving you control
the is not possible using the OS provided titlebar such as the color.</p>
<p>NOTE LINUX USERS - at the moment the minimize function is not yet working.  Windows users
should have no problem and it should function as a normal window would.</p>
<p>This titlebar is created from a row of elements that is then encapsulated into a
one Column element which is what this Titlebar function returns to you.</p>
<p>A custom titlebar removes the margins from your window.  If you want the  remainder
of your Window to have margins, place the layout after the Titlebar into a Column and
set the pad of that Column to the dimensions you would like your margins to have.</p>
<p>The Titlebar is a COLUMN element.  You can thus call the update method for the column and
perform operations such as making the column visible/invisible</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Titlebar(title = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes or None</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>Can be either a filename or Base64 byte string of a PNG or GIF. This is used in an Image element to create the titlebar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>The "title" to show in the titlebar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>Text color for titlebar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>Background color for titlebar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>Font to be used for the text and the symbols</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object or None</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Identifies an Element. Should be UNIQUE to this window.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object or None</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Exactly the same as key. Choose one of them to use</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Column</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>A single Column element that has eveything in 1 element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="tree-element">Tree Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs vbnet">Tree Element - Presents data <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> a tree-<span class="hljs-built_in">like</span> manner, much <span class="hljs-built_in">like</span> a file/folder browser.  Uses the TreeData <span class="hljs-keyword">class</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> hold the user<span class="hljs-comment">'s data and pass to the element for display.</span>
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-meta">Tree(data</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">headings</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">visible_column_map</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">col_widths</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">col0_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">10,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">col0_heading</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">def_col_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">10,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">auto_size_columns</span> = <span class="hljs-string">True,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">max_col_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">20,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">select_mode</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">show_expanded</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">change_submits</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">enable_events</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">font</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">justification</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"right",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">text_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">border_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">selected_row_colors</span> = <span class="hljs-string">(None, None),</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">header_text_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">header_background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">header_font</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">header_border_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">header_relief</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">num_rows</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">sbar_trough_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">sbar_background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">sbar_arrow_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">sbar_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">sbar_arrow_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">sbar_frame_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">sbar_relief</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">row_height</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">vertical_scroll_only</span> = <span class="hljs-string">True,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">hide_vertical_scroll</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">pad</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">p</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">key</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">k</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">tooltip</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">right_click_menu</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_x</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_y</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">visible</span> = <span class="hljs-string">True,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">metadata</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>

<td>Text to be shown in the header for the left-most column</td>

<td>default column width</td>
</tr>

<td>if True, the size of a column is determined using the contents of the column</td>

<td>max_col_width</td>
<td>the maximum size a column can be</td>

<td>Use same values as found on Table Element. Valid values include: TABLE_SELECT_MODE_NONE TABLE_SELECT_MODE_BROWSE TABLE_SELECT_MODE_EXTENDED</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>show_expanded</td>
<td>if True then the tree will be initially shown with all nodes completely expanded</td>
</tr>

<td>bool</td>
<td>change_submits</td>
<td>DO NOT USE. Only listed for backwards compat - Use enable_events instead</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_events</td>
<td>Turns on the element specific events. Tree events happen when row is clicked</td>
</tr>

<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>

<td>justification</td>

</tr>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or (str, str)</td>
<td>selected_row_colors</td>
<td>Sets the text color and background color for a selected row. Same format as button colors - tuple ('red', 'yellow') or string 'red on yellow'. Defaults to theme's button color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>header_text_color</td>
<td>sets the text color for the header</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>header_background_color</td>
<td>sets the background color for the header</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>header_font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int or None)</td>
<td>header_border_width</td>
<td>Border width for the header portion</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or None)</td>
<td>header_relief</td>
<td>Relief style for the header. Values are same as other elements that use relief. RELIEF_RAISED RELIEF_SUNKEN RELIEF_FLAT RELIEF_RIDGE RELIEF_GROOVE RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>num_rows</td>
<td>The number of rows of the table to display at a time</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>row_height</td>
<td>height of a single row in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>vertical_scroll_only</td>
<td>if True only the vertical scrollbar will be visible</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>hide_vertical_scroll</td>
<td>if True vertical scrollbar will be hidden</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_trough_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the trough</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_background_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the background of the arrow buttons at the ends AND the color of the "thumb" (the thing you grab and slide). Switches to arrow color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the arrow at the ends of the scrollbar (it looks like a button). Switches to background color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width of the arrow on the scrollbar. It will potentially impact the overall width of the scrollbar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_frame_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar Color of frame around scrollbar (available only on some ttk themes)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_relief</td>
<td>Scrollbar relief that will be used for the "thumb" of the scrollbar (the thing you grab that slides). Should be a constant that is defined at starting with "RELIEF_" - RELIEF_RAISED, RELIEF_SUNKEN, RELIEF_FLAT, RELIEF_RIDGE, RELIEF_GROOVE, RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[str] or str]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the X direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True the element will automatically expand in the Y direction to fill available space</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set visibility state of the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="add_treeview_data">add_treeview_data</h3>
<p>Not a user function.  Recursive method that inserts tree data into the tkinter treeview widget.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">add_treeview_data</span>(node)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>TreeData</td>
<td>node</td>
<td>The node to insert. Will insert all nodes from starting point downward, recursively</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_27">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="block_focus_24">block_focus</h3>
<p>Enable or disable the element from getting focus by using the keyboard.
If the block parameter is True, then this element will not be given focus by using
the keyboard to go from one element to another.
You CAN click on the element and utilize it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">block_focus(block</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>block</td>
<td>if True the element will not get focus via the keyboard</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_27">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="get_size_27">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_27">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_27">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_27">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_25">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_25">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_27">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_27">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_27">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_27">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_27">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_27">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_tooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>

<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_vscroll_position_10">set_vscroll_position</h3>
<p>Attempts to set the vertical scroll postition for an element's Widget</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_vscroll_position</span>(percent_from_top)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>percent_from_top</td>
<td>From 0 to 1.0, the percentage from the top to move scrollbar to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_27">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">unbind</span>(bind_string)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unhide_row_27">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="update_47">update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Tree Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    icon <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    visible <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>TreeData</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>Representation of the tree</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>identifies a particular item in tree to update</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>sets the node identified by key to a particular value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>sets the node identified by key to this string</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>can be either a base64 icon or a filename for the icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>control visibility of element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="visible_27">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_27">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_27">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_27">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_26">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="setfocus_26">SetFocus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">SetFocus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="settooltip_26">SetTooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetTooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>

<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="update_48">Update</h3>
<p>Changes some of the settings for the Tree Element. Must call <code>Window.Read</code> or <code>Window.Finalize</code> prior</p>
<p>Changes will not be visible in your window until you call window.read or window.refresh.</p>
<p>If you change visibility, your element may MOVE. If you want it to remain stationary, use the "layout helper"
function "pin" to ensure your element is "pinned" to that location in your layout so that it returns there
when made visible.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Update</span>(<span class="hljs-keyword">values</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">value</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    text <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    icon <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,

<hr>
<h2 id="treedata-for-tree-element">TreeData (for Tree Element)</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs vbnet"><span class="hljs-keyword">Class</span> that user fills <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> represent their tree data. It<span class="hljs-comment">'s a very simple tree representation with a root "Node"</span>
<span class="hljs-keyword">with</span> possibly one <span class="hljs-built_in">or</span> more children <span class="hljs-string">"Nodes"</span>.  <span class="hljs-keyword">Each</span> Node contains a <span class="hljs-keyword">key</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">text</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> display, list <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> values <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> display
<span class="hljs-built_in">and</span> an icon.  The entire tree <span class="hljs-built_in">is</span> built <span class="hljs-keyword">using</span> a <span class="hljs-type">single</span> method, Insert.  <span class="hljs-literal">Nothing</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">is</span> required <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> make the tree.
</code></pre>
<p>Instantiate the object, initializes the Tree Data, creates a root node for you</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">TreeData()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="node">Node</h3>
<p>Contains information about the individual node in the tree</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">Node(parent,
    key,
    text,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">values</span>,
    icon <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<h3 id="insert">insert</h3>
<p>Inserts a node into the tree. This is how user builds their tree, by Inserting Nodes
This is the ONLY user callable method in the TreeData class</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">insert</span>(parent,
    key,
    text,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">values</span>,
    icon <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Node</td>
<td>parent</td>
<td>the parent Node</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used to uniquely identify this node</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>The text that is displayed at this node's location</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>The list of values that are displayed at this node</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>icon</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="insert_1">Insert</h3>
<p>Inserts a node into the tree. This is how user builds their tree, by Inserting Nodes
This is the ONLY user callable method in the TreeData class</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-keyword">Insert</span>(parent,
    key,
    text,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">values</span>,
    icon <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Node</td>
<td>parent</td>
<td>the parent Node</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used to uniquely identify this node</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text</td>
<td>The text that is displayed at this node's location</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[Any]</td>
<td>values</td>
<td>The list of values that are displayed at this node</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>icon</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="verticalseparator-element">VerticalSeparator Element</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs coffeescript">Vertical Separator Element draws a vertical line at the given location. It will span <span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-string">"row"</span>. Usually paired <span class="hljs-keyword">with</span>
Column Element <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> extra height <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> needed
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs python">VerticalSeparator(color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>color</td>
<td>Color of the line. Defaults to theme's text color. Can be name or #RRGGBB format</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Value that uniquely identifies this element from all other elements. Used when Finding an element or in return values. Must be unique to the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_28">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to an Element.
The tkinter specific data is in the Element's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">bind(bind_string,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">key_modifier,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">propagate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>key_modifier</td>
<td>Additional data to be added to the element's key when event is returned</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event to the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="expand_28">expand</h3>
<p>Causes the Element to expand to fill available space in the X and Y directions.  Can specify which or both directions</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">expand(expand_x</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_y</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span>
    <span class="hljs-string">expand_row</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_row</td>
<td>If True the row containing the element will also expand. Without this your element is "trapped" within the row</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_next_focus_28">get_next_focus</h3>
<p>Gets the next element that should get focus after this element.</p>
<p><code>get_next_focus()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Element)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Element that will get focus after this one</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_previous_focus_28">get_previous_focus</h3>

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Element)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="get_size_28">get_size</h3>
<p>Return the size of an element in Pixels.  Care must be taken as some elements use characters to specify their size but will return pixels when calling this get_size method.</p>
<p><code>get_size()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>width and height of the element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_exclude_28">grab_anywhere_exclude</h3>
<p>Excludes this element from being used by the grab_anywhere feature
        Handy for elements like a Graph element when dragging is enabled. You want the Graph element to get the drag events instead of the window dragging.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_exclude()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grab_anywhere_include_28">grab_anywhere_include</h3>
<p>Includes this element in the grab_anywhere feature
        This will allow you to make a Multline element drag a window for example</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">grab_anywhere_include()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_row_28">hide_row</h3>
<p>Hide the entire row an Element is located on.
        Use this if you must have all space removed when you are hiding an element, including the row container</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="key_26">key</h3>
<h4 id="property-key_26">property: key</h4>
<p>Returns key for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
Keys can be any hashable object (basically anything except a list... tuples are ok, but not lists)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The window's Key</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="metadata_28">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_28">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an Element property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_28">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the current Element.
"Cursor" is used in 2 different ways in this call.
For the parameter "cursor" it's actually the mouse pointer.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"
For the parameter "cursor_color" it's the color of the beam used when typing into an input element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">set_cursor(<span class="hljs-keyword">cursor</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, cursor_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor_color</td>
<td>color to set the "cursor" to</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_focus_28">set_focus</h3>
<p>Sets the current focus to be on this element</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">set_focus(force</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>force</td>
<td>if True will call focus_force otherwise calls focus_set</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_size_28">set_size</h3>
<p>Changes the size of an element to a specific size.
It's possible to specify None for one of sizes so that only 1 of the element's dimensions are changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_size(size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>The size in characters, rows typically. In some cases they are pixels</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_tooltip_28">set_tooltip</h3>
<p>Called by application to change the tooltip text for an Element.  Normally invoked using the Element Object such as: window.Element('key').SetToolTip('New tip').</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_tooltip</span>(tooltip_text)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip_text</td>
<td>the text to show in tooltip.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unbind_28">unbind</h3>
<p>Removes a previously bound tkinter event from an Element.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">unbind</span>(bind_string)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>

<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="unhide_row_28">unhide_row</h3>
<p>Unhides (makes visible again) the row container that the Element is located on.
        Note that it will re-appear at the bottom of the window / container, most likely.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">unhide_row()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="visible_28">visible</h3>
<h4 id="property-visible_28">property: visible</h4>
<p>Returns visibility state for the element.  This is a READONLY property</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Visibility state for element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="widget_28">widget</h3>
<h4 id="property-widget_28">property: widget</h4>
<p>Returns tkinter widget for the element.  This is a READONLY property.
The implementation is that the Widget member variable is returned. This is a backward compatible addition</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(tkinter.Widget)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>The element's underlying tkinter widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="vpush-element-aliases-include-vp-and-vstretch">VPush Element (aliases include <code>VP</code> and <code>VStretch</code>)</h2>
<p>Like the <code>Push</code> element, this is not a true element but rather a function acting like an element.  It will "Push" all elements above and below away from it.</p>
<p>Example:  If first row has a <code>VPush</code>, then your layout will be At the bottom of the container it is in.  If one is on the last row, then the layout will be at the top of the container.  If you use TWO <code>VPush</code>, one on the first row and one on the last row, then your layout will be centered vertically.</p>
<p>Acts like a Stretch element found in the Qt port.
Used in a Vertical fashion.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">VPush</span>(background_color = None)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background may be needed because of how this is implemented</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere_using_control</td>
<td>If True can use CONTROL key + left mouse mouse to click and drag to move the window. DEFAULT is TRUE. Unlike normal grab anywhere, it works on all elements.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True, window will be created on top of all other windows on screen. It can be bumped down if another window created with this parm</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>resizable</td>
<td>If True, allows the user to resize the window. Note the not all Elements will change size or location when resizing.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disable_close</td>
<td>If True, the X button in the top right corner of the window will no work. Use with caution and always give a way out toyour users</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disable_minimize</td>
<td>if True the user won't be able to minimize window. Good for taking over entire screen and staying that way.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>right_click_menu</td>
<td>A list of lists of Menu items to show when this element is right clicked. See user docs for exact format.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>transparent_color</td>

</tr>

<td>bool</td>
<td>debugger_enabled</td>
<td>If True then the internal debugger will be enabled</td>
</tr>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str or Tuple</td>
<td>right_click_menu_selected_colors</td>
<td>Text AND background colors for a selected item. Can be a Tuple OR a color string. simplified-button-color-string "foreground on background". Can be a single color if want to set only the background. Normally a tuple, but can be a simplified-dual-color-string "foreground on background". Can be a single color if want to set only the background.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>right_click_menu_font</td>
<td>Font for right click menus</td>
</tr>

<td>bool</td>
<td>right_click_menu_tearoff</td>
<td>If True then all right click menus can be torn off</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>finalize</td>
<td>If True then the Finalize method will be called. Use this rather than chaining .Finalize for cleaner code</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>element_justification</td>
<td>All elements in the Window itself will have this justification 'left', 'right', 'center' are valid values</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>ttk_theme</td>
<td>Set the tkinter ttk "theme" of the window. Default = DEFAULT_TTK_THEME. Sets all ttk widgets to this theme as their default</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>use_ttk_buttons</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then this window will be the only window a user can interact with until it is closed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_close_attempted_event</td>
<td>If True then the window will not close when "X" clicked. Instead an event WINDOW_CLOSE_ATTEMPTED_EVENT if returned from window.read</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>enable_window_config_events</td>
<td>If True then window configuration events (resizing or moving the window) will return WINDOW_CONFIG_EVENT from window.read. Note you will get several when Window is created.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or None)</td>
<td>titlebar_background_color</td>
<td>If custom titlebar indicated by use_custom_titlebar, then use this as background color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or None)</td>
<td>titlebar_text_color</td>
<td>If custom titlebar indicated by use_custom_titlebar, then use this as text color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>titlebar_font</td>
<td>If custom titlebar indicated by use_custom_titlebar, then use this as title font</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bytes or str)</td>
<td>titlebar_icon</td>
<td>If custom titlebar indicated by use_custom_titlebar, then use this as the icon (file or base64 bytes)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>use_custom_titlebar</td>
<td>If True, then a custom titlebar will be used instead of the normal titlebar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>scaling</td>
<td>Apply scaling to the elements in the window. Can be set on a global basis using set_options</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_trough_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the trough</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_background_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the background of the arrow buttons at the ends AND the color of the "thumb" (the thing you grab and slide). Switches to arrow color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar color of the arrow at the ends of the scrollbar (it looks like a button). Switches to background color when mouse is over</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width in pixels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>sbar_arrow_width</td>
<td>Scrollbar width of the arrow on the scrollbar. It will potentially impact the overall width of the scrollbar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_frame_color</td>
<td>Scrollbar Color of frame around scrollbar (available only on some ttk themes)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sbar_relief</td>
<td>Scrollbar relief that will be used for the "thumb" of the scrollbar (the thing you grab that slides). Should be a constant that is defined at starting with "RELIEF_" - RELIEF_RAISED, RELIEF_SUNKEN, RELIEF_FLAT, RELIEF_RIDGE, RELIEF_GROOVE, RELIEF_SOLID</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="add_row_3">add_row</h3>
<p>Adds a single row of elements to a window's self.Rows variables.
Generally speaking this is NOT how users should be building Window layouts.
Users, create a single layout (a list of lists) and pass as a parameter to Window object, or call Window.Layout(layout)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">add_row</span>(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> or N object&gt;)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>List[Elements]</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="add_rows">add_rows</h3>
<p>Loops through a list of lists of elements and adds each row, list, to the layout.
This is NOT the best way to go about creating a window.  Sending the entire layout at one time and passing
it as a parameter to the Window call is better.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">add_rows</span>(rows)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Elements]]</td>
<td>rows</td>
<td>A list of a list of elements</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="alpha_channel">alpha_channel</h3>
<h4 id="property-alpha_channel">property: alpha_channel</h4>
<p>A property that changes the current alpha channel value (internal value)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(float)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current alpha channel setting according to self, not read directly from tkinter</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bind_29">bind</h3>
<p>Used to add tkinter events to a Window.
The tkinter specific data is in the Window's member variable user_bind_event</p>
<pre><code class="hljs vbnet">bind(bind_string,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">key</span>,
    propagate = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>bind_string</td>
<td>The string tkinter expected in its bind function</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>The event that will be generated when the tkinter event occurs</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>propagate</td>
<td>If True then tkinter will be told to propagate the event</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bring_to_front">bring_to_front</h3>
<p>Brings this window to the top of all other windows (perhaps may not be brought before a window made to "stay
        on top")</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">bring_to_front()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="close">close</h3>
<p>Closes window.  Users can safely call even if window has been destroyed.   Should always call when done with
        a window so that resources are properly freed up within your thread.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">close()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="current_location">current_location</h3>
<p>Get the current location of the window's top left corner.
Sometimes, depending on the environment, the value returned does not include the titlebar,etc
A new option, more_accurate, can be used to get the theoretical upper leftmost corner of the window.
The titlebar and menubar are crated by the OS. It gets really confusing when running in a webpage (repl, trinket)
Thus, the values can appear top be "off" due to the sometimes unpredictable way the location is calculated.
If without_titlebar is set then the location of the root x,y is used which should not include the titlebar but
may be OS dependent.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">current_location(more_accurate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span> <span class="hljs-string">without_titlebar</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>more_accurate</td>
<td>If True, will use the window's geometry to get the topmost location with titlebar, menubar taken into account</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>without_titlebar</td>
<td>If True, return location of top left of main window area without the titlebar (may be OS dependent?)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[(int or None), (int or None)]</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>The x and y location in tuple form (x,y)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="ding">ding</h3>

<h3 id="disappear">disappear</h3>
<p>Causes a window to "disappear" from the screen, but remain on the taskbar. It does this by turning the alpha
        channel to 0.  NOTE that on some platforms alpha is not supported. The window will remain showing on these
        platforms.  The Raspberry Pi for example does not have an alpha setting</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">disappear()
</code></pre>

<h3 id="finalize">finalize</h3>
<p>Use this method to cause your layout to built into a real tkinter window.  In reality this method is like
Read(timeout=0).  It doesn't block and uses your layout to create tkinter widgets to represent the elements.
Lots of action!</p>
<p><code>finalize()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Window)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Returns 'self' so that method "Chaining" can happen (read up about it as it's very cool!)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="find">find</h3>
<h3 id="find_element">find_element</h3>
<p>Find element object associated with the provided key.
THIS METHOD IS NO LONGER NEEDED to be called by the user</p>
<p>You can perform the same operation by writing this statement:
element = window[key]</p>
<p>You can drop the entire "find_element" function name and use [ ] instead.</p>
<p>However, if you wish to perform a lookup without error checking, and don't have error popups turned
off globally, you'll need to make this call so that you can disable error checks on this call.</p>
<p>find_element is typically used in combination with a call to element's update method (or any other element method!):
window[key].update(new_value)</p>
<p>Versus the "old way"
window.FindElement(key).Update(new_value)</p>
<p>This call can be abbreviated to any of these:
find_element = FindElement == Element == Find
With find_element being the PEP8 compliant call that should be used.</p>
<p>Rememeber that this call will return None if no match is found which may cause your code to crash if not
checked for.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">find_element(key,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">silent_on_error</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">supress_guessing</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">supress_raise</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>silent_on_error</td>
<td>If True do not display popup nor print warning of key errors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>supress_guessing</td>
<td>Override for the global key guessing setting.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>supress_raise</td>
<td>Override for the global setting that determines if a key error should raise an exception</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Element or ErrorElement or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Return value can be: the Element that matches the supplied key if found; an Error Element if silent_on_error is False; None if silent_on_error True</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
