<h3 id="get_screen_size">get_screen_size</h3>
<p>This is a "Class Method" meaning you call it by writing: width, height = Window.get_screen_size()
Returns the size of the "screen" as determined by tkinter.  This can vary depending on your operating system and the number of monitors installed on your system.  For Windows, the primary monitor's size is returns. On some multi-monitored Linux systems, the monitors are combined and the total size is reported as if one screen.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">get_screen_size</span>()
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Size of the screen in pixels as determined by tkinter</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="grab_any_where_off">grab_any_where_off</h3>

</code></pre>

<h3 id="layout_6">layout</h3>

from history and replace with sending as a parameter to Window.</p>

<h3 id="maximize">maximize</h3>
<p>Maximize the window. This is done differently on a windows system versus a linux or mac one.  For non-Windows
        the root attribute '-fullscreen' is set to True.  For Windows the "root" state is changed to "zoomed"
        The reason for the difference is the title bar is removed in some cases when using fullscreen option</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">maximize()
</code></pre>

<h3 id="move_to_center">move_to_center</h3>
<p>Recenter your window after it's been moved or the size changed.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs coffeescript">    This <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> a conveinence method. There are <span class="hljs-literal">no</span> tkinter calls involved, only pure PySimpleGUI API calls.

</code></pre>
<h3 id="normal">normal</h3>
<p>Restore a window to a non-maximized state.  Does different things depending on platform.  See Maximize for more.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">normal()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="perform_long_operation">perform_long_operation</h3>
<p>Call your function that will take a long time to execute.  When it's complete, send an event
specified by the end_key.</p>
<p>Starts a thread on your behalf.</p>
<p>This is a way for you to "ease into" threading without learning the details of threading.
Your function will run, and when it returns 2 things will happen:
1. The value you provide for end_key will be returned to you when you call window.read()
2. If your function returns a value, then the value returned will also be included in your windows.read call in the values dictionary</p>
<p>IMPORTANT - This method uses THREADS... this means you CANNOT make any PySimpleGUI calls from
the function you provide with the exception of one function, Window.write_event_value.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs go">perform_long_operation(<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">func</span>, <span class="hljs-title">end_key</span>)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>func</td>
<td>A lambda or a function name with no parms</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>end_key</td>
<td>The key that will be generated when the function returns</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>threading.Thread</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>The id of the thread</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="read">read</h3>
<p>THE biggest deal method in the Window class! This is how you get all of your data from your Window.
Pass in a timeout (in milliseconds) to wait for a maximum of timeout milliseconds. Will return timeout_key
if no other GUI events happen first.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">read(timeout <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    timeout_key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> "__TIMEOUT__",
    <span class="hljs-keyword">close</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>timeout</td>
<td>Milliseconds to wait until the Read will return IF no other GUI events happen first</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>timeout_key</td>
<td>The value that will be returned from the call if the timer expired</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>close</td>
<td>if True the window will be closed prior to returning</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[(Any), Dict[Any, Any], List[Any], None]</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>(event, values)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="reappear">reappear</h3>
<p>Causes a window previously made to "Disappear" (using that method). Does this by restoring the alpha channel</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">reappear()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="refresh">refresh</h3>
<p>Refreshes the window by calling tkroot.update().  Can sometimes get away with a refresh instead of a Read.
Use this call when you want something to appear in your Window immediately (as soon as this function is called).
If you change an element in a window, your change will not be visible until the next call to Window.read
or a call to Window.refresh()</p>
<p><code>refresh()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Window)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td><code>self</code> so that method calls can be easily "chained"</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="save_to_disk">save_to_disk</h3>
<p>Saves the values contained in each of the input areas of the form. Basically saves what would be returned from a call to Read.  It takes these results and saves them to disk using pickle.
 Note that every element in your layout that is to be saved must have a key assigned to it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">save_to_disk</span>(filename)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>filename</td>
<td>Filename to save the values to in pickled form</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="save_window_screenshot_to_disk">save_window_screenshot_to_disk</h3>
<p>Saves an image of the PySimpleGUI window provided into the filename provided</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">save_window_screenshot_to_disk</span>(filename = None)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(PIL.ImageGrab or None)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>A PIL ImageGrab object that can be saved or manipulated</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="send_to_back">send_to_back</h3>
<p>Pushes this window to the bottom of the stack of windows. It is the opposite of BringToFront</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">send_to_back()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="set_alpha">set_alpha</h3>
<p>Sets the Alpha Channel for a window.  Values are between 0 and 1 where 0 is completely transparent</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_alpha</span>(alpha)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>alpha</td>
<td>0 to 1. 0 is completely transparent. 1 is completely visible and solid (can't see through)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_cursor_29">set_cursor</h3>
<p>Sets the cursor for the window.
If you do not want any mouse pointer, then use the string "none"</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">set_cursor</span>(cursor)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

</tr>

<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>cursor</td>
<td>The tkinter cursor name</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_icon">set_icon</h3>
<p>Changes the icon that is shown on the title bar and on the task bar.
NOTE - The file type is IMPORTANT and depends on the OS!
Can pass in:
* filename which must be a .ICO icon file for windows, PNG file for Linux
* bytes object
* BASE64 encoded file held in a variable</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">set_icon(icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, pngbase64 = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>Filename or bytes object</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes</td>
<td>pngbase64</td>
<td>Base64 encoded image</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="set_min_size">set_min_size</h3>

<h3 id="start_thread">start_thread</h3>
<p>Call your function that will take a long time to execute.  When it's complete, send an event
specified by the end_key.</p>
<p>Starts a thread on your behalf.</p>
<p>This is a way for you to "ease into" threading without learning the details of threading.
Your function will run, and when it returns 2 things will happen:
1. The value you provide for end_key will be returned to you when you call window.read()
2. If your function returns a value, then the value returned will also be included in your windows.read call in the values dictionary</p>
<p>IMPORTANT - This method uses THREADS... this means you CANNOT make any PySimpleGUI calls from
the function you provide with the exception of one function, Window.write_event_value.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs go">start_thread(<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">func</span>, <span class="hljs-title">end_key</span>)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>func</td>
<td>A lambda or a function name with no parms</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>end_key</td>
<td>The key that will be generated when the function returns</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>threading.Thread</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>The id of the thread</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="un_hide">un_hide</h3>
<p>Used to bring back a window that was previously hidden using the Hide method</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">un_hide()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="visibility_changed">visibility_changed</h3>
<p>When making an element in a column or someplace that has a scrollbar, then you'll want to call this function
        prior to the column's contents_changed() method.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">visibility_changed()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="was_closed">was_closed</h3>

<h3 id="widget_to_element">widget_to_element</h3>
<p>Returns the element that matches a supplied tkinter widget.
If no matching element is found, then None is returned.</p>

</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>

<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>

<td>Element that uses the specified widget</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="write_event_value">write_event_value</h3>
<p>Adds a key &amp; value tuple to the queue that is used by threads to communicate with the window</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">write_event_value</span>(key, value)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>The key that will be returned as the event when reading the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>value</td>
<td>The value that will be in the values dictionary</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_27">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p><strong><em>Do not use these</em></strong>... they are here for your reference should you see them in old code.</p>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>
<h3 id="addrow_3">AddRow</h3>
<p>Adds a single row of elements to a window's self.Rows variables.
Generally speaking this is NOT how users should be building Window layouts.
Users, create a single layout (a list of lists) and pass as a parameter to Window object, or call Window.Layout(layout)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">AddRow</span>(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> or N object&gt;)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>List[Elements]</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="addrows">AddRows</h3>
<p>Loops through a list of lists of elements and adds each row, list, to the layout.
This is NOT the best way to go about creating a window.  Sending the entire layout at one time and passing
it as a parameter to the Window call is better.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">AddRows</span>(rows)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Elements]]</td>
<td>rows</td>
<td>A list of a list of elements</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="alphachannel">AlphaChannel</h3>
<h4 id="property-alphachannel">property: AlphaChannel</h4>
<p>A property that changes the current alpha channel value (internal value)</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(float)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current alpha channel setting according to self, not read directly from tkinter</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="bringtofront">BringToFront</h3>
<p>Brings this window to the top of all other windows (perhaps may not be brought before a window made to "stay
        on top")</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">BringToFront()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="close_1">Close</h3>
<p>Closes window.  Users can safely call even if window has been destroyed.   Should always call when done with
        a window so that resources are properly freed up within your thread.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">Close()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="currentlocation">CurrentLocation</h3>
<p>Get the current location of the window's top left corner.
Sometimes, depending on the environment, the value returned does not include the titlebar,etc
A new option, more_accurate, can be used to get the theoretical upper leftmost corner of the window.
The titlebar and menubar are crated by the OS. It gets really confusing when running in a webpage (repl, trinket)
Thus, the values can appear top be "off" due to the sometimes unpredictable way the location is calculated.
If without_titlebar is set then the location of the root x,y is used which should not include the titlebar but
may be OS dependent.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs yaml"><span class="hljs-string">CurrentLocation(more_accurate</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">,</span> <span class="hljs-string">without_titlebar</span> <span class="hljs-string">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span><span class="hljs-string">)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>more_accurate</td>
<td>If True, will use the window's geometry to get the topmost location with titlebar, menubar taken into account</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>without_titlebar</td>
<td>If True, return location of top left of main window area without the titlebar (may be OS dependent?)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[(int or None), (int or None)]</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>The x and y location in tuple form (x,y)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="disable_1">Disable</h3>
<p>Disables window from taking any input from the user</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">Disable()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="disabledebugger">DisableDebugger</h3>
<p>Disable the internal debugger. By default the debugger is ENABLED</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">DisableDebugger()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="disappear_1">Disappear</h3>
<p>Causes a window to "disappear" from the screen, but remain on the taskbar. It does this by turning the alpha
        channel to 0.  NOTE that on some platforms alpha is not supported. The window will remain showing on these
        platforms.  The Raspberry Pi for example does not have an alpha setting</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">Disappear()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="elem_1">Elem</h3>
<p>Find element object associated with the provided key.
THIS METHOD IS NO LONGER NEEDED to be called by the user</p>
<p>You can perform the same operation by writing this statement:
element = window[key]</p>
<p>You can drop the entire "find_element" function name and use [ ] instead.</p>
<p>However, if you wish to perform a lookup without error checking, and don't have error popups turned
off globally, you'll need to make this call so that you can disable error checks on this call.</p>
<p>find_element is typically used in combination with a call to element's update method (or any other element method!):
window[key].update(new_value)</p>
<p>Versus the "old way"
window.FindElement(key).Update(new_value)</p>
<p>This call can be abbreviated to any of these:
find_element = FindElement == Element == Find
With find_element being the PEP8 compliant call that should be used.</p>
<p>Rememeber that this call will return None if no match is found which may cause your code to crash if not
checked for.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">Elem(key,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">silent_on_error</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">supress_guessing</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">supress_raise</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>silent_on_error</td>
<td>If True do not display popup nor print warning of key errors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>supress_guessing</td>
<td>Override for the global key guessing setting.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>supress_raise</td>
<td>Override for the global setting that determines if a key error should raise an exception</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Element or ErrorElement or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Return value can be: the Element that matches the supplied key if found; an Error Element if silent_on_error is False; None if silent_on_error True</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="element_1">Element</h3>
<p>Find element object associated with the provided key.
THIS METHOD IS NO LONGER NEEDED to be called by the user</p>
<p>You can perform the same operation by writing this statement:
element = window[key]</p>
<p>You can drop the entire "find_element" function name and use [ ] instead.</p>
<p>However, if you wish to perform a lookup without error checking, and don't have error popups turned
off globally, you'll need to make this call so that you can disable error checks on this call.</p>
<p>find_element is typically used in combination with a call to element's update method (or any other element method!):
window[key].update(new_value)</p>
<p>Versus the "old way"
window.FindElement(key).Update(new_value)</p>
<p>This call can be abbreviated to any of these:
find_element = FindElement == Element == Find
With find_element being the PEP8 compliant call that should be used.</p>
<p>Rememeber that this call will return None if no match is found which may cause your code to crash if not
checked for.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql"><span class="hljs-built_in">Element</span>(key,
    silent_on_error <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    supress_guessing <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    supress_raise <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>silent_on_error</td>
<td>If True do not display popup nor print warning of key errors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>supress_guessing</td>
<td>Override for the global key guessing setting.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>supress_raise</td>
<td>Override for the global setting that determines if a key error should raise an exception</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Element or ErrorElement or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Return value can be: the Element that matches the supplied key if found; an Error Element if silent_on_error is False; None if silent_on_error True</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="enable_1">Enable</h3>
<p>Re-enables window to take user input after having it be Disabled previously</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">Enable()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="enabledebugger">EnableDebugger</h3>
<p>Enables the internal debugger. By default, the debugger IS enabled</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">EnableDebugger()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="fill_1">Fill</h3>
<p>Fill in elements that are input fields with data based on a 'values dictionary'</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">Fill</span>(values_dict)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Dict[Any, Any]) - {Element_key : value}</td>
<td>values_dict</td>
<td>pairs</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Window)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>returns self so can be chained with other methods</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="finalize_1">Finalize</h3>
<p>Use this method to cause your layout to built into a real tkinter window.  In reality this method is like
Read(timeout=0).  It doesn't block and uses your layout to create tkinter widgets to represent the elements.
Lots of action!</p>
<p><code>Finalize()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Window)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>Returns 'self' so that method "Chaining" can happen (read up about it as it's very cool!)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="find_1">Find</h3>
<p>Find element object associated with the provided key.
THIS METHOD IS NO LONGER NEEDED to be called by the user</p>
<p>You can perform the same operation by writing this statement:
element = window[key]</p>
<p>You can drop the entire "find_element" function name and use [ ] instead.</p>
<p>However, if you wish to perform a lookup without error checking, and don't have error popups turned
off globally, you'll need to make this call so that you can disable error checks on this call.</p>
<p>find_element is typically used in combination with a call to element's update method (or any other element method!):
window[key].update(new_value)</p>
<p>Versus the "old way"
window.FindElement(key).Update(new_value)</p>
<p>This call can be abbreviated to any of these:
find_element = FindElement == Element == Find
With find_element being the PEP8 compliant call that should be used.</p>
<p>Rememeber that this call will return None if no match is found which may cause your code to crash if not
checked for.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">Find(key,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">silent_on_error</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">supress_guessing</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">supress_raise</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used with window.find_element and with return values to uniquely identify this element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>silent_on_error</td>
<td>If True do not display popup nor print warning of key errors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>supress_guessing</td>
<td>Override for the global key guessing setting.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>supress_raise</td>
<td>Override for the global setting that determines if a key error should raise an exception</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Element or ErrorElement or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Return value can be: the Element that matches the supplied key if found; an Error Element if silent_on_error is False; None if silent_on_error True</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="findelement">FindElement</h3>
<p><strong> Warning </strong> This call will eventually be depricated. **</p>
<p>It is suggested that you modify your code to use the recommended window[key] lookup or the PEP8 compliant window.find_element(key)</p>
<p>For now, you'll only see a message printed and the call will continue to funcation as before.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs vbnet">FindElement(<span class="hljs-keyword">key</span>, silent_on_error = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>

</tr>
</thead>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>silent_on_error</td>
<td>If True do not display popup nor print warning of key errors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Element or Error Element or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Return value can be: the Element that matches the supplied key if found; an Error Element if silent_on_error is False; None if silent_on_error True;</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="grabanywhereoff">GrabAnyWhereOff</h3>
<p>Turns off Grab Anywhere functionality AFTER a window has been created.  Don't try on a window that's not yet
        been Finalized or Read.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">GrabAnyWhereOff()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="grabanywhereon">GrabAnyWhereOn</h3>
<p>Turns on Grab Anywhere functionality AFTER a window has been created.  Don't try on a window that's not yet
        been Finalized or Read.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">GrabAnyWhereOn()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_1">Hide</h3>

</code></pre>
<h3 id="layout_7">Layout</h3>
<p>Second of two preferred ways of telling a Window what its layout is. The other way is to pass the layout as
a parameter to Window object.  The parameter method is the currently preferred method. This call to Layout
has been removed from examples contained in documents and in the Demo Programs. Trying to remove this call
from history and replace with sending as a parameter to Window.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">Layout</span>(rows)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[Elements]]</td>
<td>rows</td>
<td>Your entire layout</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Window)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>self so that you can chain method calls</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="loadfromdisk">LoadFromDisk</h3>

<h3 id="maximize_1">Maximize</h3>
<p>Maximize the window. This is done differently on a windows system versus a linux or mac one.  For non-Windows
        the root attribute '-fullscreen' is set to True.  For Windows the "root" state is changed to "zoomed"
        The reason for the difference is the title bar is removed in some cases when using fullscreen option</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">Maximize()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="minimize_1">Minimize</h3>
<p>Minimize this window to the task bar</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">Minimize()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="move_3">Move</h3>

</code></pre>

<h3 id="normal_1">Normal</h3>
<p>Restore a window to a non-maximized state.  Does different things depending on platform.  See Maximize for more.</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">Normal()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="read_1">Read</h3>
<p>THE biggest deal method in the Window class! This is how you get all of your data from your Window.
Pass in a timeout (in milliseconds) to wait for a maximum of timeout milliseconds. Will return timeout_key
if no other GUI events happen first.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">Read(timeout <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    timeout_key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> "__TIMEOUT__",
    <span class="hljs-keyword">close</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>timeout</td>
<td>Milliseconds to wait until the Read will return IF no other GUI events happen first</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>timeout_key</td>
<td>The value that will be returned from the call if the timer expired</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>close</td>
<td>if True the window will be closed prior to returning</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[(Any), Dict[Any, Any], List[Any], None]</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>(event, values)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="reappear_1">Reappear</h3>
<p>Causes a window previously made to "Disappear" (using that method). Does this by restoring the alpha channel</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">Reappear()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="refresh_1">Refresh</h3>
<p>Refreshes the window by calling tkroot.update().  Can sometimes get away with a refresh instead of a Read.
Use this call when you want something to appear in your Window immediately (as soon as this function is called).
If you change an element in a window, your change will not be visible until the next call to Window.read
or a call to Window.refresh()</p>
<p><code>Refresh()</code></p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Window)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td><code>self</code> so that method calls can be easily "chained"</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="savetodisk">SaveToDisk</h3>
<p>Saves the values contained in each of the input areas of the form. Basically saves what would be returned from a call to Read.  It takes these results and saves them to disk using pickle.
 Note that every element in your layout that is to be saved must have a key assigned to it.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SaveToDisk</span>(filename)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>filename</td>
<td>Filename to save the values to in pickled form</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="sendtoback">SendToBack</h3>
<p>Pushes this window to the bottom of the stack of windows. It is the opposite of BringToFront</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">SendToBack()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="setalpha">SetAlpha</h3>
<p>Sets the Alpha Channel for a window.  Values are between 0 and 1 where 0 is completely transparent</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">SetAlpha</span>(alpha)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>alpha</td>
<td>0 to 1. 0 is completely transparent. 1 is completely visible and solid (can't see through)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="seticon">SetIcon</h3>
<p>Changes the icon that is shown on the title bar and on the task bar.
NOTE - The file type is IMPORTANT and depends on the OS!
Can pass in:
* filename which must be a .ICO icon file for windows, PNG file for Linux
* bytes object
* BASE64 encoded file held in a variable</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">SetIcon(icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, pngbase64 = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>Filename or bytes object</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes</td>
<td>pngbase64</td>
<td>Base64 encoded image</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</code></pre>
<hr>
<h2 id="layout-helper-funcs">Layout Helper Funcs</h2>
<p>Pin's an element provided into a layout so that when it's made invisible and visible again, it will
 be in the correct place.  Otherwise it will be placed at the end of its containing window/column.</p>
<p>The element you want to pin is the element that you'll be making visibile/invisible.</p>
<p>The pin helper function also causes containers to shrink to fit the contents correct after something inside
 has changed visiblity.  Note that setting a hardcoded size on your window can impact this ability to shrink.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">pin(elem,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">vertical_alignment</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">shrink</span> = <span class="hljs-string">True,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_x</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_y</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Element</td>
<td>elem</td>
<td>the element to put into the layout</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td>vertical_alignment</td>
<td>Aligns elements vertically. 'top', 'center', 'bottom'. Can be shortened to 't', 'c', 'b'</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>shrink</td>
<td>If True, then the space will shrink down to a single pixel when hidden. False leaves the area large and blank</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True/False the value will be passed to the Column Elements used to make this feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True/False the value will be passed to the Column Elements used to make this feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Column</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>A column element containing the provided element</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Align an element or a row of elements to the bottom of the row that contains it</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">vbottom(elem_or_row,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_x</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_y</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Element or List[Element] or Tuple[Element]</td>
<td>elem_or_row</td>
<td>the element or row of elements</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True/False the value will be passed to the Column Elements used to make this feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True/False the value will be passed to the Column Elements used to make this feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>Background color for container that is used by vcenter to do the alignment</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Column or List[Column]</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>A column element containing the provided element aligned to the bottom or list of elements (a row)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Align an element or a row of elements to the center of the row that contains it</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">vcenter(elem_or_row,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_x</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_y</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Element or List[Element] or Tuple[Element]</td>
<td>elem_or_row</td>
<td>the element or row of elements</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True/False the value will be passed to the Column Elements used to make this feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True/False the value will be passed to the Column Elements used to make this feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>Background color for container that is used by vcenter to do the alignment</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Column or List[Column]</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>A column element containing the provided element aligned to the center or list of elements (a row)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Align an element or a row of elements to the top of the row that contains it</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">vtop(elem_or_row,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_x</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">expand_y</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">background_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>

</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Element or List[Element] or Tuple[Element]</td>
<td>elem_or_row</td>
<td>the element or row of elements</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True/False the value will be passed to the Column Elements used to make this feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True/False the value will be passed to the Column Elements used to make this feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>Background color for container that is used by vtop to do the alignment</td>
</tr>

<h2 id="systemtray-only-for-qt-and-wx-ports-use-psgtray-package-for-the-tkinter-port">SystemTray  - Only for Qt and Wx ports. Use <code>psgtray</code> package for the tkinter port</h2>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">A "Simulated System Tray" that duplicates the API calls available <span class="hljs-keyword">to</span> PySimpleGUIWx <span class="hljs-keyword">and</span> PySimpleGUIQt users.

<span class="hljs-keyword">All</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> the functionality works. The icon <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> displayed ABOVE the <span class="hljs-keyword">system</span> tray rather than inside <span class="hljs-keyword">of</span> it.
</code></pre>
<p>SystemTray - create an icon in the system tray</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">SystemTray(menu = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    filename = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    data = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    data_base64 = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>List[List[List[str] or str]]</td>
<td>menu</td>
<td>Menu definition. Example - ['UNUSED', ['My', 'Simple', '---', 'Menu', 'Exit']]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>filename</td>
<td>filename for icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes</td>
<td>data</td>
<td>in-ram image for icon (same as data_base64 parm)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes</td>
<td>data_base64</td>
<td>base-64 data for icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>tooltip string</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>User metadata that can be set to ANYTHING</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="close_2">close</h3>
<p>Close the system tray window</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">close()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="hide_2">hide</h3>
<p>Hides the icon</p>
<pre><code class="language-python hljs">hide()
</code></pre>
<h3 id="metadata_30">metadata</h3>
<h4 id="property-metadata_30">property: metadata</h4>
<p>Metadata is an SystemTray property that you can use at any time to hold any value</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>(Any)</td>
<td><strong>return</strong></td>
<td>the current metadata value</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="notify">notify</h3>
<p>Displays a "notification window", usually in the bottom right corner of your display.  Has an icon, a title, and a message
The window will slowly fade in and out if desired.  Clicking on the window will cause it to move through the end the current "phase". For example, if the window was fading in and it was clicked, then it would immediately stop fading in and instead be fully visible.  It's a way for the user to quickly dismiss the window.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">notify(title,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">message,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">icon</span> = <span class="hljs-string">...,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">display_duration_in_ms</span> = <span class="hljs-string">3000,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">fade_in_duration</span> = <span class="hljs-string">1000,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">alpha</span> = <span class="hljs-string">0.9,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">location</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Text to be shown at the top of the window in a larger font</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>message</td>
<td>Text message that makes up the majority of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>A base64 encoded PNG/GIF image or PNG/GIF filename that will be displayed in the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>display_duration_in_ms</td>
<td>Number of milliseconds to show the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>fade_in_duration</td>
<td>Number of milliseconds to fade window in and out</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>alpha</td>
<td>Alpha channel. 0 - invisible 1 - fully visible</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location on the screen to display the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>(int) reason for returning</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<h3 id="these-are-non-pep8-compliant-methods-do-not-use_28">These are non-PEP8 Compliant Methods - do NOT use</h3>
<p>The following methods are here for backwards compatibility reference.  You will find there are PEP8 versions for each of these methods.  The PEP8 versions will be all lower case and have underscores.</p>

<h2 id="version-info">Version Info</h2>
<p>Returns a human-readable string of version numbers for:</p>
<p>Python version
Platform (Win, Mac, Linux)
Platform version (tuple with information from the platform module)
PySimpleGUI Port (PySimpleGUI in this case)
tkinter version
PySimpleGUI version
The location of the PySimpleGUI.py file</p>
<p>The format is a newline between each value and descriptive text for each line</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">get_versions</span>()
</code></pre>
<h2 id="multi-window-interface">Multi-window Interface</h2>
<p>Reads all windows that are "active" when the call is made. "Active" means that it's been finalized or read.
If a window has not been finalized then it will not be considered an "active window"</p>
<p>If any of the active windows returns a value then the window and its event and values
are returned.</p>
<p>If no windows are open, then the value (None, WIN_CLOSED, None) will be returned
Since WIN_CLOSED is None, it means (None, None, None) is what's returned when no windows remain opened</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">read_all_windows</span>(timeout = None, timeout_key = <span class="hljs-string">"__TIMEOUT__"</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>timeout</td>
<td>Time in milliseconds to delay before a returning a timeout event</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>timeout_key</td>
<td>Key to return when a timeout happens. Defaults to the standard TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Window, Any, Dict or List)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>A tuple with the  (Window, event, values dictionary/list)</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h2 id="pre-defined-buttons-use-in-your-layout">Pre-Defined Buttons (use in your layout)</h2>
<p>Button that will show a calendar chooser window.  Fills in the target element with result</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">CalendarButton(button_text,
    target = (<span class="hljs-number">555666777</span>, -<span class="hljs-number">1</span>),
    close_when_date_chosen = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    default_date_m_d_y = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    image_filename = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    image_data = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    image_size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    image_subsample = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    border_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    auto_size_button = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    disabled = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    bind_return_key = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    focus = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    enable_events = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    locale = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-built_in">format</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"</span>,
    begin_at_sunday_plus = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    month_names = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    day_abbreviations = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    title = <span class="hljs-string">"Choose Date"</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    expand_x = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>

</tr>

<td>(Default = False) If True, this button will appear to be clicked when return key is pressed in other elements such as Input and elements with return key options</td>

<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>focus</td>

<td>key</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[str]</td>
<td>day_abbreviations</td>
<td>optional list of abbreviations to display as the day of week</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Title shown on the date chooser window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>if True no titlebar will be shown on the date chooser window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set initial visibility state of the Button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>Anything you want to store along with this button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Button)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>returns a button</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Cancel(button_text = <span class="hljs-string">"Cancel"</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    auto_size_button = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)

<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>

<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>button_text</td>
<td>text in the button (Default value = 'Cancel')</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(w,h) w=characters-wide, h=rows-high</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_button</td>
<td>True if button size is determined by button text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>bind_return_key</td>
<td>(Default = False) If True, this button will appear to be clicked when return key is pressed in other elements such as Input and elements with return key options</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>focus</td>
<td>if focus should be set to this</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>

</tr>

<p>This Button has been changed in how it works!!
Your button has been replaced with a normal button that has the PySimpleGUI Debugger buggon logo on it.
In your event loop, you will need to check for the event of this button and then call:
show_debugger_popout_window()</p>

<p>This is a special type of Button.</p>
<p>It will close the window but NOT send an event that the window has been closed.</p>
<p>It's used in conjunction with non-blocking windows to silently close them.  They are used to
implement the non-blocking popup windows. They're also found in some Demo Programs, so look there for proper use.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">DummyButton(button_text,

</tr>

</tr>

<p>Allows browsing of multiple files. File list is returned as a single list with the delimiter defined using the files_delimiter parameter.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">FilesBrowse(button_text = <span class="hljs-string">"Browse"</span>,
    target = (<span class="hljs-number">555666777</span>, -<span class="hljs-number">1</span>),

    initial_folder = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

<pre><code class="hljs python">Help(button_text = <span class="hljs-string">"Help"</span>,

</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_button</td>
<td>True if button size is determined by button text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>bind_return_key</td>
<td>(Default = False) If True, this button will appear to be clicked when return key is pressed in other elements such as Input and elements with return key options</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>focus</td>
<td>if focus should be set to this</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>key for uniquely identify this element (for window.find_element)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set initial visibility state of the Button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>Anything you want to store along with this button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Button)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>returns a button</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_button</td>
<td>True if button size is determined by button text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>bind_return_key</td>
<td>(Default = False) If True, this button will appear to be clicked when return key is pressed in other elements such as Input and elements with return key options</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>focus</td>
<td>if focus should be set to this</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>key for uniquely identify this element (for window.find_element)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set initial visibility state of the Button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>Anything you want to store along with this button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Button)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>returns a button</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<pre><code class="hljs python">Yes(button_text = <span class="hljs-string">"Yes"</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    s = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    auto_size_button = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    disabled = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    tooltip = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    bind_return_key = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    focus = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    pad = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    p = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    key = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    k = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    visible = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    metadata = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    expand_x = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    expand_y = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>button_text</td>
<td>text in the button (Default value = 'Yes')</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(w,h) w=characters-wide, h=rows-high</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_button</td>
<td>True if button size is determined by button text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>tooltip</td>
<td>text, that will appear when mouse hovers over the element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>bind_return_key</td>
<td>(Default = True) If True, this button will appear to be clicked when return key is pressed in other elements such as Input and elements with return key options</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td>focus</td>
<td>if focus should be set to this</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>key for uniquely identify this element (for window.find_element)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>visible</td>
<td>set initial visibility state of the Button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>Anything you want to store along with this button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Button)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>returns a button</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h2 id="button-functions-no-longer-used-do-not-use">Button Functions No Longer Used (DO NOT USE)</h2>
<p>Note - These are no longer recommended! 
They are shown here in case you run into them in some old code.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">RButton(button_text,
    image_filename = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    image_data = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    image_size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    image_subsample = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    border_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)  or (None, None) or int</td>
<td>s</td>
<td>Same as size parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, size will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_size_button</td>
<td>True if button size is determined by button text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>bind_return_key</td>
<td>(Default = False) If True, this button will appear to be clicked when return key is pressed in other elements such as Input and elements with return key options</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>disabled</td>
<td>set disable state for element (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>idk_yetReally</td>
<td>focus</td>
<td>if focus should be set to this</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>pad</td>
<td>Amount of padding to put around element in pixels (left/right, top/bottom) or ((left, right), (top, bottom)) or an int. If an int, then it's converted into a tuple (int, int)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int or (int, int),(int,int) or int,(int,int)) or  ((int, int),int) or int</td>
<td>p</td>
<td>Same as pad parameter. It's an alias. If EITHER of them are set, then the one that's set will be used. If BOTH are set, pad will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>key for uniquely identify this element (for window.find_element)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>k</td>
<td>Same as the Key. You can use either k or key. Which ever is set will be used.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>metadata</td>
<td>Anything you want to store along with this button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_x</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Horizontal directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>expand_y</td>
<td>If True Element will expand in the Vertical directions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(Button)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>returns a button</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="debug-window-output">Debug Window Output</h2>
<p>Works like a "print" statement but with windowing options.  Routes output to the "Debug Window"</p>
<p>In addition to the normal text and background colors, you can use a "colors" tuple/string
The "colors" or "c" parameter defines both the text and background in a single parm.
It can be a tuple or a single single. Both text and background colors need to be specified
colors -(str, str) or str.  A combined text/background color definition in a single parameter
c - (str, str) - Colors tuple has format (foreground, backgrouned)
c - str - can also be a string of the format "foreground on background"  ("white on red")</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">easy_print(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    end = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sep = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    no_button = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    do_not_reroute_stdout = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    echo_stdout = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    colors = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    c = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    erase_all = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    resizable = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    wait = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>stuff to output</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(w,h) w=characters-wide, h=rows-high</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>end</td>
<td>end character</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sep</td>
<td>separator character</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_button</td>
<td>don't show button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True: can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>do_not_reroute_stdout</td>
<td>do not reroute stdout and stderr. If False, both stdout and stderr will reroute to here</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>echo_stdout</td>
<td>If True stdout is sent to both the console and the debug window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or str, str</td>
<td>colors</td>
<td>Either a tuple or a string that has both the text and background colors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or str, str</td>
<td>c</td>
<td>Either a tuple or a string that has both the text and background colors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>resizable</td>
<td>if True, the user can resize the debug window. Default is True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>erase_all</td>
<td>If True when erase the output before printing</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>blocking</td>
<td>if True, makes the window block instead of returning immediately. The "Quit" button changers to "More"</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>wait</td>
<td>Same as the "blocking" parm. It's an alias. if True, makes the window block instead of returning immediately. The "Quit" button changes to "Click to Continue..."</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>do_not_reroute_stdout</td>
<td>do not reroute stdout and stderr. If False, both stdout and stderr will reroute to here</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>echo_stdout</td>
<td>If True stdout is sent to both the console and the debug window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or str, str</td>
<td>colors</td>
<td>Either a tuple or a string that has both the text and background colors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or str, str</td>
<td>c</td>
<td>Either a tuple or a string that has both the text and background colors</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>resizable</td>
<td>if True, the user can resize the debug window. Default is True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>erase_all</td>
<td>If True when erase the output before printing</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>blocking</td>
<td>if True, makes the window block instead of returning immediately. The "Quit" button changers to "More"</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool or None)</td>
<td>wait</td>
<td>Same as the "blocking" parm. It's an alias. if True, makes the window block instead of returning immediately. The "Quit" button changes to "Click to Continue..."</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Close a previously opened EasyPrint window</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">EasyPrintClose</span>()
</code></pre>
<p>Works like a "print" statement but with windowing options.  Routes output to the "Debug Window"</p>
<p>In addition to the normal text and background colors, you can use a "colors" tuple/string
The "colors" or "c" parameter defines both the text and background in a single parm.
It can be a tuple or a single single. Both text and background colors need to be specified
colors -(str, str) or str.  A combined text/background color definition in a single parameter
c - (str, str) - Colors tuple has format (foreground, backgrouned)
c - str - can also be a string of the format "foreground on background"  ("white on red")</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Print(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    end = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    sep = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    no_button = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    do_not_reroute_stdout = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    echo_stdout = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    colors = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    c = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    erase_all = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    resizable = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    wait = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
