<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">PrintClose</span>()
</code></pre>
<h2 id="color-printing-to-multiline-element-of-a-window">Color Printing to Multiline Element of a Window</h2>
<p>Color print to a multiline element in a window of your choice.
Must have EITHER called cprint_set_output_destination prior to making this call so that the
window and element key can be saved and used here to route the output, OR used the window
and key parameters to the cprint function to specicy these items.</p>
<p>args is a variable number of things you want to print.</p>
<p>end - The end char to use just like print uses
sep - The separation character like print uses
text_color - The color of the text
key - overrides the previously defined Multiline key
window - overrides the previously defined window to output to
background_color - The color of the background
colors -(str, str) or str.  A combined text/background color definition in a single parameter</p>
<p>There are also "aliases" for text_color, background_color and colors (t, b, c)
 t - An alias for color of the text (makes for shorter calls)
b - An alias for the background_color parameter
c - (str, str) - "shorthand" way of specifying color. (foreground, backgrouned)
c - str - can also be a string of the format "foreground on background"  ("white on red")</p>
<p>With the aliases it's possible to write the same print but in more compact ways:
cprint('This will print white text on red background', c=('white', 'red'))
cprint('This will print white text on red background', c='white on red')
cprint('This will print white text on red background', text_color='white', background_color='red')
cprint('This will print white text on red background', t='white', b='red')</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">cprint(args<span class="hljs-operator">=</span><span class="hljs-operator">*</span><span class="hljs-operator">&lt;</span><span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N object<span class="hljs-operator">&gt;</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">end</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    sep <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> " ",
    text_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    font <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    t <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    background_color <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    b <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    colors <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    c <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    <span class="hljs-keyword">window</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    key <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    justification <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    autoscroll <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    erase_all <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>stuff to output</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>Color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike for the value being updated</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>The background color of the line</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or str, str</td>
<td>colors</td>
<td>Either a tuple or a string that has both the text and background colors "text on background" or just the text color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>t</td>
<td>Color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>b</td>
<td>The background color of the line</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or str, str</td>
<td>c</td>
<td>Either a tuple or a string. Same as the color parm</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>end</td>
<td>end character</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>sep</td>
<td>separator character</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>key of multiline to output to (if you want to override the one previously set)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Window</td>
<td>window</td>
<td>Window containing the multiline to output to (if you want to override the one previously set)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>justification</td>
<td>text justification. left, right, center. Can use single characters l, r, c. Sets only for this value, not entire element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>autoscroll</td>
<td>If True the contents of the element will automatically scroll as more data added to the end</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Sets up the color print (cprint) output destination</p>
<pre><code class="hljs coffeescript">cprint_set_output_destination(<span class="hljs-built_in">window</span>, multiline_key)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Window</td>
<td>window</td>
<td>The window that the cprint call will route the output to</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>multiline_key</td>
<td>Key for the Multiline Element where output will be sent</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>None</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<hr>
<h2 id="one-line-progress-meter">One Line Progress Meter</h2>
<p>Add a progress meter to your application by adding 1 line of code.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">one_line_progress_meter(title,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">current_value,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">max_value,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">args</span>=<span class="hljs-string">*&lt;1 or N object&gt;,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">key</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"OK for 1 meter",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">orientation</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"v",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">bar_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">(None, None),</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">button_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">size</span> = <span class="hljs-string">(20, 20),</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">border_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">grab_anywhere</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">no_titlebar</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">keep_on_top</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">no_button</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False)</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>text to display in titlebar of window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>current_value</td>
<td>current value</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>max_value</td>
<td>max value of progress meter</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>stuff to output as text in the window along with the meter</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or int or tuple or object</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Used to differentiate between multiple meters. Used to cancel meter early. Now optional as there is a default value for single meters</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>orientation</td>
<td>'horizontal' or 'vertical' ('h' or 'v' work) (Default value = 'vertical' / 'v')</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>bar_color</td>
<td>The 2 colors that make up a progress bar. Either a tuple of 2 strings or a string. Tuple - (bar, background). A string with 1 color changes the background of the bar only. A string with 2 colors separated by "on" like "red on blue" specifies a red bar on a blue background.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(w,h) w=characters-wide, h=rows-high (Default value = DEFAULT_PROGRESS_BAR_SIZE)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>border_width</td>
<td>width of border around element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True: can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True: no titlebar will be shown on the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_button</td>
<td>If True: window will be created without a cancel button</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(bool)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>True if updated successfully. False if user closed the meter with the X or Cancel button</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Cancels and closes a previously created One Line Progress Meter window</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">one_line_progress_meter_cancel</span>(key = <span class="hljs-string">"OK for 1 meter"</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>key</td>
<td>Key used when meter was created</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>None</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h3 id="non-pep8-versions">NON-PEP8 Versions</h3>
<p>Don't use these.  They are here in case you're searching for them.  Instead use the PEP8 version <code>one_line_progress_meter</code>.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs properties"><span class="hljs-attr">OneLineProgressMeter(title,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">current_value,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">max_value,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">args</span>=<span class="hljs-string">*&lt;1 or N object&gt;,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">key</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"OK for 1 meter",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">orientation</span> = <span class="hljs-string">"v",</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">bar_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">(None, None),</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">button_color</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">size</span> = <span class="hljs-string">(20, 20),</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">border_width</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">grab_anywhere</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">no_titlebar</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">keep_on_top</span> = <span class="hljs-string">None,</span>
    <span class="hljs-attr">no_button</span> = <span class="hljs-string">False)</span>
</code></pre>

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">

</tr>
<tr>

<td>The 2 colors that make up a progress bar. Either a tuple of 2 strings or a string. Tuple - (bar, background). A string with 1 color changes the background of the bar only. A string with 2 colors separated by "on" like "red on blue" specifies a red bar on a blue background.</td>

<h2 id="popups-pep8-versions">Popups PEP8 Versions</h2>
<p>Popup - Display a popup Window with as many parms as you wish to include.  This is the GUI equivalent of the
"print" statement.  It's also great for "pausing" your program's flow until the user can read some error messages.</p>
<p>If this popup doesn't have the features you want, then you can easily make your own. Popups can be accomplished in 1 line of code:
choice, _ = sg.Window('Continue?', [[sg.T('Do you want to continue?')], [sg.Yes(s=10), sg.No(s=10)]], disable_close=True).read(close=True)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">popup(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_type = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    auto_close = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    custom_text = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    non_blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    line_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    any_key_closes = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    button_justification = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    drop_whitespace = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>Variable number of your arguments. Load up the call with stuff to see!</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Optional title for the window. If none provided, the first arg will be used instead.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>Color of the buttons shown (text color, button color)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>Window's background color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>text color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>button_type</td>
<td>NOT USER SET! Determines which pre-defined buttons will be shown (Default value = POPUP_BUTTONS_OK). There are many Popup functions and they call Popup, changing this parameter to get the desired effect.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_close</td>
<td>If True the window will automatically close</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>auto_close_duration</td>
<td>time in seconds to keep window open before closing it automatically</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>custom_text</td>
<td>A string or pair of strings that contain the text to display on the buttons</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>non_blocking</td>
<td>If True then will immediately return from the function without waiting for the user's input.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>icon to display on the window. Same format as a Window call</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>line_width</td>
<td>Width of lines in characters. Defaults to MESSAGE_BOX_LINE_WIDTH</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or Tuple[font_name, size, modifiers]</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True will not show the frame around the window and the titlebar across the top</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True can grab anywhere to move the window. If no_titlebar is True, grab_anywhere should likely be enabled too</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location on screen to display the top left corner of window. Defaults to window centered on screen</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>any_key_closes</td>
<td>If True then will turn on return_keyboard_events for the window which will cause window to close as soon as any key is pressed. Normally the return key only will close the window. Default is false.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>right_justify_buttons</td>
<td>If True then the buttons will be "pushed" to the right side of the Window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>button_justification</td>
<td>Speficies if buttons should be left, right or centered. Default is left justified</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>drop_whitespace</td>
<td>Controls is whitespace should be removed when wrapping text. Parameter is passed to textwrap.fill. Default is to drop whitespace (so popup remains backward compatible)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Show animation one frame at a time.  This function has its own internal clocking meaning you can call it at any frequency
 and the rate the frames of video is shown remains constant.  Maybe your frames update every 30 ms but your
 event loop is running every 10 ms.  You don't have to worry about delaying, just call it every time through the
 loop.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">popup_animated(image_source,
    message = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    alpha_channel = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    time_between_frames = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    transparent_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    title = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes or None</td>
<td>image_source</td>
<td>Either a filename or a base64 string. Use None to close the window.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>message</td>
<td>An optional message to be shown with the animation</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or tuple</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True then the titlebar and window frame will not be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True then you can move the window just clicking anywhere on window, hold and drag</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True then Window will remain on top of all other windows currently shownn</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>(x,y) location on the screen to place the top left corner of your window. Default is to center on screen</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>alpha_channel</td>
<td>Window transparency 0 = invisible 1 = completely visible. Values between are see through</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>time_between_frames</td>
<td>Amount of time in milliseconds between each frame</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>transparent_color</td>
<td>This color will be completely see-through in your window. Can even click through</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Title that will be shown on the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>Same as Window icon parameter. Can be either a filename or Base64 byte string. For Windows if filename, it MUST be ICO format. For Linux, must NOT be ICO</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>True if the window updated OK. False if the window was closed</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Popup that closes itself after some time period</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">popup_auto_close(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,

</tr>

<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True: can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>

</tr>

<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None or TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td>str or None or TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Show an error message and as many additoinal lines of messages as you want.
Will show the same error window as PySimpleGUI uses internally.  Has a button to
take the user to the line of code you called this popup from.
If you include the Exception information in your messages, then it will be parsed and additional information
will be in the window about such as the specific line the error itself occurred on.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs less"><span class="hljs-selector-tag">popup_error_with_traceback</span>(title,
    messages,
    emoji = None)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>The title that will be shown in the popup's titlebar and in the first line of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*messages</td>
<td>A variable number of lines of messages you wish to show your user</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes</td>
<td>emoji</td>
<td>An optional BASE64 Encoded image to shows in the error window</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Display a calendar window, get the user's choice, return as a tuple (mon, day, year)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">popup_get_date(start_mon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    start_day = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    start_year = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    begin_at_sunday_plus = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    title = <span class="hljs-string">"Choose Date"</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    close_when_chosen = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    locale = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    month_names = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    day_abbreviations = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    day_font = <span class="hljs-string">"TkFixedFont 9"</span>,
    mon_year_font = <span class="hljs-string">"TkFixedFont 10"</span>,
    arrow_font = <span class="hljs-string">"TkFixedFont 7"</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>start_mon</td>
<td>The starting month</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or None</td>
<td>start_day</td>
<td>The starting day - optional. Set to None or 0 if no date to be chosen at start</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>start_year</td>
<td>The starting year</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>begin_at_sunday_plus</td>
<td>Determines the left-most day in the display. 0=sunday, 1=monday, etc</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or bytes)</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>Same as Window icon parameter. Can be either a filename or Base64 value. For Windows if filename, it MUST be ICO format. For Linux, must NOT be ICO</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>(x,y) location on the screen to place the top left corner of your window. Default is to center on screen</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Title that will be shown on the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>close_when_chosen</td>
<td>If True, the window will close and function return when a day is clicked</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>locale</td>
<td>locale used to get the day names</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[str]</td>
<td>month_names</td>
<td>optional list of month names to use (should be 12 items)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[str]</td>
<td>day_abbreviations</td>
<td>optional list of abbreviations to display as the day of week</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or tuple</td>
<td>day_font</td>
<td>Font and size to use for the calendar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or tuple</td>
<td>mon_year_font</td>
<td>Font and size to use for the month and year at the top</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or tuple</td>
<td>arrow_font</td>
<td>Font and size to use for the arrow buttons</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>None or (int, int, int)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Tuple containing (month, day, year) of chosen date or None if was cancelled</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Display popup window with text entry field and browse button so that a file can be chosen by user.</p>

    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    default_path = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    default_extension = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    save_as = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    multiple_files = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    file_types = ((<span class="hljs-string">'ALL Files'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'*.* *'</span>),),
    no_window = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),

</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>default_path</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>save_as</td>
<td>if True, the "save as" dialog is shown which will verify before overwriting</td>

<td>bool</td>
<td>multiple_files</td>
<td>if True, then allows multiple files to be selected that are returned with ';' between each filename</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[Tuple[str,str]]</td>
<td>file_types</td>
<td>List of extensions to show using wildcards. All files (the default) = (("ALL Files", "<em>.</em> *"),).</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_window</td>

</tr>

<td>button_color</td>
<td>Color of the button (text, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>background color of the entire window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>

<td>bytes or str</td>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True: can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>

<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>

</tr>

<td>str</td>
<td>initial_folder</td>
<td>location in filesystem to begin browsing</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>files_delimiter</td>
<td>String to place between files when multiple files are selected. Normally a ;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>history</td>
<td>If True then enable a "history" feature that will display previous entries used. Uses settings filename provided or default if none provided</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>show_hidden</td>
<td>If True then enables the checkbox in the system dialog to select hidden files to be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>history_setting_filename</td>
<td>Filename to use for the User Settings. Will store list of previous entries in this settings file</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>string representing the file(s) chosen, None if cancelled or window closed with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<p>Display Popup with text entry field. Returns the text entered or None if closed / cancelled</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">popup_get_text(message,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    default_text = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    password_char = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

</tr>

<td>Text entered or None if window was closed or cancel button clicked</td>
</tr>

<p>Makes a "popup menu"
This type of menu is what you get when a normal menu or a right click menu is torn off
The settings for the menu are obtained from the window parameter's Window</p>
<pre><code class="hljs sql">popup_menu(<span class="hljs-keyword">window</span>,
    element,
    menu_def,
    title <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>,
    location <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> (<span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">None</span>))
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Window</td>
<td>window</td>
<td>The window associated with the popup menu. The theme and right click menu settings for this window will be used</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Element</td>
<td>element</td>
<td>An element in your window to associate the menu to. It can be any element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>List[List[ List[str] or str ]]</td>
<td>menu_def</td>
<td>A menu definition. This will be the same format as used for Right Click Menus1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>The title that will be shown on the torn off menu window. Defaults to window titlr</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int) or (None, None)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>The location on the screen to place the window</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Show a Popup but without any buttons</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">popup_no_buttons(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    auto_close = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    non_blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    line_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>Variable number of items to display</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>

<td>Title to display in the window.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>

<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_close</td>
<td>if True window will close itself</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>auto_close_duration</td>
<td>Older versions only accept int. Time in seconds until window will close</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>non_blocking</td>
<td>If True then will immediately return from the function without waiting for the user's input. (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>filename or base64 string to be used for the window's icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>line_width</td>
<td>Width of lines in characters</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True, than can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None or TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Display a Popup without a titlebar.   Enables grab anywhere so you can move it</p>

<p>Show Popup window and immediately return (does not block)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">popup_non_blocking(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_type = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,

<td>Reason for popup closing</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Displays a "notification window", usually in the bottom right corner of your display.  Has an icon, a title, and a message.  It is more like a "toaster" window than the normal popups.</p>
<p>The window will slowly fade in and out if desired.  Clicking on the window will cause it to move through the end the current "phase". For example, if the window was fading in and it was clicked, then it would immediately stop fading in and instead be fully visible.  It's a way for the user to quickly dismiss the window.</p>
<p>The return code specifies why the call is returning (e.g. did the user click the message to dismiss it)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs apache"><span class="hljs-attribute">popup_notify</span>(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> or N object&gt;,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">title</span> = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">icon</span> = ...,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">display_duration_in_ms</span> = <span class="hljs-number">3000</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">fade_in_duration</span> = <span class="hljs-number">1000</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">alpha</span> = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>.<span class="hljs-number">9</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attribute">location</span> = None)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Text to be shown at the top of the window in a larger font</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>message</td>
<td>Text message that makes up the majority of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>A base64 encoded PNG/GIF image or PNG/GIF filename that will be displayed in the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>display_duration_in_ms</td>
<td>Number of milliseconds to show the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>fade_in_duration</td>
<td>Number of milliseconds to fade window in and out</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>alpha</td>
<td>Alpha channel. 0 - invisible 1 - fully visible</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location on the screen to display the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int)</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>reason for returning</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>"OK" or "Cancel" or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>clicked button</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Show Popup box that doesn't block and closes itself</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">popup_quick(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_type = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    auto_close = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-number">2</span>,
    non_blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    line_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>

<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>

<td>Older versions only accept int. Time in seconds until window will close</td>
</tr>

<td>bool</td>
<td>non_blocking</td>
<td>if True the call will immediately return rather than waiting on user input</td>
</tr>

</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True: can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None or TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

want, just like a print statement.</p>

<h3 id="sprint-popup-alias-same-as-popup_scrolled"><code>sprint</code> Popup Alias - Same as popup_scrolled</h3>
<p>Show a scrolled Popup window containing the user's text that was supplied.  Use with as many items to print as you
want, just like a print statement.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">sprint(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    yes_no = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    no_buttons = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    button_justification = <span class="hljs-string">"l"</span>,
    auto_close = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    non_blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,

</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>filename or base64 string to be used for the window's icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_sizegrip</td>
<td>If True no Sizegrip will be shown when there is no titlebar. It's only shown if there is no titlebar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None or TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Show a scrolled Popup window containing the user's text that was supplied.  Use with as many items to print as you
want, just like a print statement.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">ScrolledTextBox(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    yes_no = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    no_buttons = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    button_justification = <span class="hljs-string">"l"</span>,
    auto_close = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    non_blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    no_sizegrip = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>

</tr>

<td>bool</td>
<td>non_blocking</td>
<td>if True the call will immediately return rather than waiting on user input</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True, than can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>

<h2 id="popup-not-pep8-compliant-names">Popup Not PEP8 Compliant names</h2>
<p><strong><em> You should not use these function names! </em></strong> </p>
<p>These versions of the popup functions are here only for backwards compatibility. Instead use the popup functions that have snake_case rather than CamelCase.</p>
<p>Popup - Display a popup Window with as many parms as you wish to include.  This is the GUI equivalent of the
"print" statement.  It's also great for "pausing" your program's flow until the user can read some error messages.</p>
<p>If this popup doesn't have the features you want, then you can easily make your own. Popups can be accomplished in 1 line of code:
choice, _ = sg.Window('Continue?', [[sg.T('Do you want to continue?')], [sg.Yes(s=10), sg.No(s=10)]], disable_close=True).read(close=True)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">Popup(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_type = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    auto_close = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    custom_text = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    non_blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    line_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    any_key_closes = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    button_justification = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    drop_whitespace = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>Variable number of your arguments. Load up the call with stuff to see!</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Optional title for the window. If none provided, the first arg will be used instead.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>Color of the buttons shown (text color, button color)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>Window's background color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>text color</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>button_type</td>
<td>NOT USER SET! Determines which pre-defined buttons will be shown (Default value = POPUP_BUTTONS_OK). There are many Popup functions and they call Popup, changing this parameter to get the desired effect.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_close</td>
<td>If True the window will automatically close</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>auto_close_duration</td>
<td>time in seconds to keep window open before closing it automatically</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>custom_text</td>
<td>A string or pair of strings that contain the text to display on the buttons</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>non_blocking</td>
<td>If True then will immediately return from the function without waiting for the user's input.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>icon to display on the window. Same format as a Window call</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>line_width</td>
<td>Width of lines in characters. Defaults to MESSAGE_BOX_LINE_WIDTH</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or Tuple[font_name, size, modifiers]</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True will not show the frame around the window and the titlebar across the top</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True can grab anywhere to move the window. If no_titlebar is True, grab_anywhere should likely be enabled too</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location on screen to display the top left corner of window. Defaults to window centered on screen</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>any_key_closes</td>
<td>If True then will turn on return_keyboard_events for the window which will cause window to close as soon as any key is pressed. Normally the return key only will close the window. Default is false.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>right_justify_buttons</td>
<td>If True then the buttons will be "pushed" to the right side of the Window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>button_justification</td>
<td>Speficies if buttons should be left, right or centered. Default is left justified</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>drop_whitespace</td>
<td>Controls is whitespace should be removed when wrapping text. Parameter is passed to textwrap.fill. Default is to drop whitespace (so popup remains backward compatible)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Show animation one frame at a time.  This function has its own internal clocking meaning you can call it at any frequency
 and the rate the frames of video is shown remains constant.  Maybe your frames update every 30 ms but your
 event loop is running every 10 ms.  You don't have to worry about delaying, just call it every time through the
 loop.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">PopupAnimated(image_source,
    message = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    alpha_channel = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    time_between_frames = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    transparent_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    title = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes or None</td>
<td>image_source</td>
<td>Either a filename or a base64 string. Use None to close the window.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>message</td>
<td>An optional message to be shown with the animation</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or tuple</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True then the titlebar and window frame will not be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True then you can move the window just clicking anywhere on window, hold and drag</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True then Window will remain on top of all other windows currently shownn</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>(x,y) location on the screen to place the top left corner of your window. Default is to center on screen</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>float</td>
<td>alpha_channel</td>
<td>Window transparency 0 = invisible 1 = completely visible. Values between are see through</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>time_between_frames</td>
<td>Amount of time in milliseconds between each frame</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>transparent_color</td>
<td>This color will be completely see-through in your window. Can even click through</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Title that will be shown on the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>Same as Window icon parameter. Can be either a filename or Base64 byte string. For Windows if filename, it MUST be ICO format. For Linux, must NOT be ICO</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>True if the window updated OK. False if the window was closed</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Display a Popup without a titlebar.   Enables grab anywhere so you can move it</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">PopupAnnoying(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

</tr>
<tr>

<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>

<p>Popup that closes itself after some time period</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">PopupAutoClose(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)

<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>

<th>Type</th>

</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>Variable number of items to display</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Title to display in the window.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>button_type</td>
<td>Determines which pre-defined buttons will be shown (Default value = POPUP_BUTTONS_OK).</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_close</td>
<td>if True window will close itself</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>auto_close_duration</td>
<td>Older versions only accept int. Time in seconds until window will close</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>non_blocking</td>
<td>if True the call will immediately return rather than waiting on user input</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>filename or base64 string to be used for the window's icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>line_width</td>
<td>Width of lines in characters</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True: can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None or TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<p>Display popup window with text entry field and browse button so that a file can be chosen by user.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">PopupGetFile(message,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    default_path = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    default_extension = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    save_as = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    multiple_files = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    file_types = ((<span class="hljs-string">'ALL Files'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'*.* *'</span>),),
    no_window = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    initial_folder = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    files_delimiter = <span class="hljs-string">";"</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    history = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    show_hidden = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    history_setting_filename = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>message</td>
<td>message displayed to user</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Window title</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>default_path</td>
<td>path to display to user as starting point (filled into the input field)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>default_extension</td>
<td>If no extension entered by user, add this to filename (only used in saveas dialogs)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>save_as</td>
<td>if True, the "save as" dialog is shown which will verify before overwriting</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>multiple_files</td>
<td>if True, then allows multiple files to be selected that are returned with ';' between each filename</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tuple[Tuple[str,str]]</td>
<td>file_types</td>
<td>List of extensions to show using wildcards. All files (the default) = (("ALL Files", "<em>.</em> *"),).</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_window</td>
<td>if True, no PySimpleGUI window will be shown. Instead just the tkinter dialog is shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(width, height) of the InputText Element or Combo element if using history feature</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>Color of the button (text, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>background color of the entire window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>filename or base64 string to be used for the window's icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True: can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>initial_folder</td>
<td>location in filesystem to begin browsing</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>files_delimiter</td>
<td>String to place between files when multiple files are selected. Normally a ;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>history</td>
<td>If True then enable a "history" feature that will display previous entries used. Uses settings filename provided or default if none provided</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>show_hidden</td>
<td>If True then enables the checkbox in the system dialog to select hidden files to be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>history_setting_filename</td>
<td>Filename to use for the User Settings. Will store list of previous entries in this settings file</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>string representing the file(s) chosen, None if cancelled or window closed with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<p>Display Popup with text entry field. Returns the text entered or None if closed / cancelled</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">PopupGetText(message,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    default_text = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    password_char = <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,

    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    history = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    history_setting_filename = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>message</td>
<td>message displayed to user</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Window title</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>default_text</td>
<td>default value to put into input area</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>password_char</td>
<td>character to be shown instead of actually typed characters. WARNING - if history=True then can't hide passwords</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(width, height) of the InputText Element</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>Color of the button (text, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>background color of the entire window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the message text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>filename or base64 string to be used for the window's icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True can click and drag anywhere in the window to move the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>(x,y) Location on screen to display the upper left corner of window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>history</td>
<td>If True then enable a "history" feature that will display previous entries used. Uses settings filename provided or default if none provided</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>history_setting_filename</td>
<td>Filename to use for the User Settings. Will store list of previous entries in this settings file</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Text entered or None if window was closed or cancel button clicked</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<td>Older versions only accept int. Time in seconds until window will close</td>
</tr>

</tr>

<td>str or None or TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>

</tr>

<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_close</td>
<td>if True window will close itself</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>auto_close_duration</td>
<td>Older versions only accept int. Time in seconds until window will close</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>non_blocking</td>
<td>if True the call will immediately return rather than waiting on user input</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>filename or base64 string to be used for the window's icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int</td>
<td>line_width</td>
<td>Width of lines in characters</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True: can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location of upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = False</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Reason for popup closing</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<p>Show a scrolled Popup window containing the user's text that was supplied.  Use with as many items to print as you
want, just like a print statement.</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">PopupScrolled(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    yes_no = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    no_buttons = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    button_justification = <span class="hljs-string">"l"</span>,
    auto_close = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    size = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    non_blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    modal = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    no_sizegrip = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
</code></pre>
<p>Parameter Descriptions:</p>
<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Any</td>
<td>*args</td>
<td>Variable number of items to display</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>title</td>
<td>Title to display in the window.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str, str) or str</td>
<td>button_color</td>
<td>button color (foreground, background)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>yes_no</td>
<td>If True, displays Yes and No buttons instead of Ok</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_buttons</td>
<td>If True, no buttons will be shown. User will have to close using the "X"</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>button_justification</td>
<td>How buttons should be arranged. l, c, r for Left, Center or Right justified</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>auto_close</td>
<td>if True window will close itself</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>int or float</td>
<td>auto_close_duration</td>
<td>Older versions only accept int. Time in seconds until window will close</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>size</td>
<td>(w,h) w=characters-wide, h=rows-high</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>location</td>
<td>Location on the screen to place the upper left corner of the window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(int, int)</td>
<td>relative_location</td>
<td>(x,y) location relative to the default location of the window, in pixels. Normally the window centers. This location is relative to the location the window would be created. Note they can be negative.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>non_blocking</td>
<td>if True the call will immediately return rather than waiting on user input</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>background_color</td>
<td>color of background</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str</td>
<td>text_color</td>
<td>color of the text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_titlebar</td>
<td>If True no titlebar will be shown</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>grab_anywhere</td>
<td>If True, than can grab anywhere to move the window (Default = False)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>keep_on_top</td>
<td>If True the window will remain above all current windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>(str or (str, int[, str]) or None)</td>
<td>font</td>
<td>specifies the font family, size, etc. Tuple or Single string format 'name size styles'. Styles: italic * roman bold normal underline overstrike</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or bytes</td>
<td>image</td>
<td>Image to include at the top of the popup window</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bytes or str</td>
<td>icon</td>
<td>filename or base64 string to be used for the window's icon</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>modal</td>
<td>If True then makes the popup will behave like a Modal window... all other windows are non-operational until this one is closed. Default = True</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>bool</td>
<td>no_sizegrip</td>
<td>If True no Sizegrip will be shown when there is no titlebar. It's only shown if there is no titlebar</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>str or None or TIMEOUT_KEY</td>
<td><strong>RETURN</strong></td>
<td>Returns text of the button that was pressed.  None will be returned if user closed window with X</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Popup that closes itself after some time period</p>
<pre><code class="hljs python">PopupTimed(args=*&lt;<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">or</span> N <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span>&gt;,
    title = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    button_type = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    button_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    background_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    text_color = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    auto_close = <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>,
    auto_close_duration = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    non_blocking = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    icon = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    line_width = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    font = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    no_titlebar = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    grab_anywhere = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span>,
    keep_on_top = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
    location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    relative_location = (<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>, <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>),
    image = <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
